description:
Ok this is definitely a hidden gem  in SF
LOVE THE FOOD
We celebrated my hubby's bday and we r glad we found this place
so yummy 
Parking wasn't to bad 
Food was just sooooooo yummy
author: Esther K.

description:
They open at 7:30. Doors are open, we walk in. We're told "we need another 10 minutes to open" and tell us to wait outside. Kinda not cool. 

Other than that, everything was what we come to expect from Pat's - excellent food, great ambiance. Soooooo happy to see that the Chai Latte is being served in a big mug again instead of a standard juice glass. It makes it "taste better" when it's in a giant Pat's mug!

And the French Toast - it tastes better than it ever has. More...vanilla-y, perhaps? Not sure if you changed the recipe, but if you did - keep it! It's awesome!
author: Michael H.

description:
I had a great time stopping into pat's cafe, the ambience was serene and the food was up to par, let's chat more ...
FOOD : all of their options seemed fabulous. I ended up getting the California omelette with an English muffin and fresh berries on the side. They gave you the BEST fruit. I HATE getting slumped on with the fruit when I go to restaurants, always giving me cantaloupe or honey dew melon....  come on people. But, Pat's gives you the top of the line berries : strawberries, blueberries, and half a banana came for my side and I was overjoyed. Okay, moving on to the real stuff. 
I loved my omelette. It was a pretty big portion, not to mention they were not at all modest about the avocado. Most places only give you one to two slivers of an avocado, Pat's gives you over half of an avocado... yes, nearly a whole avocado. I was shook. It was glorious. Inside the omelette is also chicken apple sausage, mushroom, and onion. The chicken apple sausage was absolutely incredible, it gave the plate flavor like no other. I was so please with how the flavors meshed together, and on top of that, I left feeling slightly full but not stuffed, which is a positive. The only down side for me was the onions... they were also not modest about those, but I'm not a big onion fan, and these onion chunks were no joke. 
All in all, my plate was fantastic. 

SERVICE : the woman who was working was extremely kind and servant hearted. She made me feel welcome and wanted. On the other hand, the man who was working made me feel like a bit of a nuisance, a fly on the wall, and someone he just needed to hurry up and serve to get out. 
I was alone, I am not a fussy or petty person, so I'm not sure what it was about me that he didn't like, but it's okay, I suppose. He seemed kind to everyone else... 
The service wasn't bad, could have been better, but it happens. 

ATMOSPHERE : they have the door open and the breeze coming in which I loved. It's an old school shop that is just really homey. They have old school jazz / blues playing and the restaurant just has that warmth to it. I liked that about this place, even if you were alone you felt at ease, accompanied. 

My experience at Pat's was great, the food is a bit pricey, but I'm from Omaha so I'm not used to paying $17 for an omelette. But, it was definitely worth it and they didn't try and skimp you on a dime, you get a full portion of food cooked to perfection. I'll be back!
author: Linden D.

description:
I'm giving the cafe a 3 because of its lovely quaint environment, the friendly staff and our short 5 minute wait to be seated. 

I wanted the food to be great. 

Unfortunately, I did not love the food. I had to have 2 shots in my latte. They couldn't make it 1.5 shots. My oatmeal was like thick tasteless dry cardboard. I had to add milk but even then it wasn't great. My daughter ordered a side of fruit which cost $8.70 and there were a few slices of banana, some blueberries and mostly chopped up strawberry. She couldn't eat it because the strawberries were so sour.
author: Nadia G.

description: This place has the best eggs Benedict I've ever had. Their hollandaise sauce is so good. Small area but very colorful and cute. Didn't have to wait for a table and service was great. Waiter was very nice and patient. Adorable outside store front and the other food was great too.
author: Bo T.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and frequent this establishment. Great breakfast options - always tasty and filling.

And Mama Pat is the friendliest! Full disclosure: not sure if she goes by Mama Pat, but it just feels/sounds right.
author: Alex L.

description:
Decent place for breakfast in Little Italy.

Food portions are way to big for my need but tasty and various. 

Prices are high like everywhere in SF.
author: Michael H.

description: Pat's was a brunch stop before we headed to the airport. The restaurant was nice in letting us place our orders while still waiting for a table and then pull together a few tables to accommodate our group of 6 and our tight timeline. The food was solid - I loved my California Crepe and Ghirardelli hot chocolate!
author: Kristin W.

description: I really loved this place! My friends were visiting SF for the weekend so we decided to have here lunch on our way to the pier. I've ordered the crab cake eggs Benedict and all my friends ordered the hamburger. Everything was really tasty. The only thing that bothered me is that I asked if there's an option to replace the potatoes with any other side dish and the waiter suggested the fruits, I was happy to hear that but I didn't know that they will charge me for that (which would have been ok if the waiter would mention this first). But nonetheless we had a delicious lunch. Me and my husband just moved nearby so we'll probably come back.
author: Anna Z.

description:
I thoroughly enjoy Pat's Cafe! I give it 5 stars because Pat herself is always there dining at her table against the wall near the register and she wears this uber cool red vest with matching red star earrings. It's such an honor to have an owner actually assist you to your table, hand you the menus, and actually eats their own establishment's cooking. The fact that I've seen Pat every time I've eaten here speaks volume about her passion for her business. 

Pat's is a solid choice for breakfast/brunch and the line doesn't get too crazy. I know everyone usually likes to go to Mama's nearby, which don't get me wrong is delicious in itself, but Pat's is also a heavy contender on the North Beach brunch scene! The decor is really cute with local artwork on the walls and plenty of colorful flowers. 

The staff here are so friendly and they're very dilligent about filling your water or your coffee! I had the Polk St. omelette, it's basically a Denver omelette with bacon added. It comes with house potatoes and toast of your choice. Solid choice in my book! I don't think you can really go wrong with anything here as my wandering eyes kept admiring all of the other patron's dishes.
author: Connie M.

description: Amazing service and food. My husband had the Chilaquiles American style and I had the Crab Omelet. Highly recommend both. We finished our food for the first time in a while because it was so very good. Large portions and full tummies for sure.
author: Artiste B.

description: This restaurant is so cute. I absolutely love it. Pat's Cafe great atmosphere and food. I ordered a French toast which was delicious. My mom ordered an oatmeal that was very dry though. Overall Pat's Cafe is a lovely little restaurant near Fisherman's Warf
author: Marni G.

description:
Cute little cafe in downtown SF. It's a tiny restaurant and they maximize space by putting tables and chairs very close to one another. There was a short wait when I arrived but my party was seated within 10 min. It was a bit awkward because the place is small so we were either standing in the way of servers or on top of another table while they were eating. 

The staff was friendly and the food was alright. I had the chicken sausage crepe. I liked it but I wasn't super impressed. It had a very healthy serving of sausage but not very much of the other fixings so I felt like I was just eating bread and meat. 

Overall if I'm in the area and needing a place for breakfast I'd likely stop by again and try out a different item on the menu.
author: Carlie S.

description: My friends and I are visiting SF for the weekend, we just had the best meal here! Easily the friendliest service we've had in this city. The breakfast dishes were fantastic!
author: Olivia W.

description:
Good but not great. 

After finding horrible queues at other breakfast places we found this place and only waited about 5 minutes to be seated which is fantastic for San Francisco! The menu was good and you have a lot to choose from. I ordered the Pancake special which unfortunately wasn't as good as I had expected. The pancakes were huge and too fluffy for me even though I'm usually a fan of fluffy american pancakes. The scrambled eggs were a bit of a joke to be honest. Not only did they not have any real flavour but there were not a lot of them and next to the huge pancakes you could have almost missed them completely. The bacon however was really nice. 

The service was good although the waiter had his thumb in my sister's food as he brought it over... I know these things happen but it's not particularly appetising.
The decor is really nice and the colours bring the place to life and make for a nice atmosphere.
The food was well presented at all so if you wanna take a cool picture of your expensive meal to make your friends jealous than this isn't the place for you. 

Overall I have to say that I wouldn't recommend this place. The food is okay, the service is okay, etc etc, but the prices are fairly high and you can find a lot of places that offer much better breakfast and even if you have to queue for a while at least it'll be worth the wait.
author: Tom H.

description: Today my friend and I came here for breakfast at 10:30 am and did not get out of there until 12 noon.  The waiter came over to our table 10 minutes after our coming in.  He took our order, which was eggs and toast for the both of us.  We were not served until 40 minutes later.  When we left at noon, we said that we would never return.  Horrible service!  Too many restaurants in the city to put up with this.
author: Julie O.

description: Excellent service, inviting atmosphere, reasonably priced for the city.  What more could you ask for?  Real maple syrup?  They have that too!  You can tell the breakfast was made to order, and arrived quickly.  I would come back.
author: Ed D.

description: Great place to have an unforgettable breakfast. Delicious omelets, good coffee, great people. Usually, it gets busy in the morning. We had pancakes with egg and bacon and also egg white with sourdough and chicken apple sausages. I will be back here!
author: Elena L.

description:
This is just one chef's opinion, but hats off to Pat and her staff. In a world where service is dwindling and food is no more than means to a financial end, Pat has kept it as it used to be. The staff care. They have fun. They treated us with amazing smiles and joy. Pat works the room. She is everywhere insuring your meal is spot on. I will be coming here every chance I get when I'm in the City. 
P.S. get the California Crepe.
author: Mark A.

description: don't waste your time going here. came with a party of 3 and got seated quickly which was nice, but it went downhill from there. the waiter who gave us our menus didn't even say hello. we got our food, 2 of us got fruit crepes and i got a yogurt bowl with fruit. the portion sizes aren't even big enough to feed a MOUSE. literally so small, so bland, and so expensive for nothing. AND i had to ask S I X times for a coffee refill before i actually got it. unacceptable and i will never be returning again.
author: Ahlam T.

description: This place is Awesome! Avocado  Toast with eggs was delish!!  Great service and Great coffee too.  Pat even seated me herself!  Edwin my server was A+++!!!   This is a must see when in San Francisco!
author: Gigi G.

description:
My wife and I stumbled across this gem last year when we were visiting San Francisco and the brilliant lady remembered it this time around. A quick Lyft ride dropped us off at the convenient location, and after a short wait we were reunited with breakfast bliss. 

Excellent breakfast, friendly service and a cozy atmosphere await you. After your belly is filled, walk a few short blocks to Fisherman's Warf for other touristy fun. 

We don't have plans to come back any time soon, but that may change when I have a hankering for pancakes again.
author: Nycole R.

description: Not so good, bad service..and picture of Egg Benedict is only on the weekends, do you not get the chiliquilles worst ever!!!
author: Desiree W.

description: Popped in for a brunch and wasn't disappointed. Staff are very friendly and polite. Very attentive. No problem in getting a table in the late morning but it was just me so probably easier to accommodate. Perfect cup of coffee (actually two). Smoke salmon eggs benedict, Outstanding! Definitely recommend it and will be coming back!
author: Luke L.

description:
I just love that place! Every time am in San francisco i go to Pat for breakfast! The service is always impecable! Food is great and the portion anre good as well! I just love it. The coffe is alse good. 

You should stop by!
author: Olivier B.

description: Good fresh food, quick preparation, reasonable by North beach standards!  I had a bacon, pepper jack egg white omelette! Very tasty as was the tomatillo salsa! I will return
author: Paul D.

description:
One of SF's hidden gems. 

The coffee is great, food is very good, and service is outstanding. You will not be disappointed.
author: Steven L.

description: This place was really nice, really cozy. I like the staff. Only reason it lost a star was because of the seating, you sit right next to strangers and it gets awkward.
author: Carlitos B.

description:
Holy moley the FOOD HERE!!! The coffee is nice and strong. Food came quickly. Cool crowd. 
The pancakes. PB chocolate chip pancakes and the chiliquiles. So flavourful. 

Come here. The food. The atmosphere. So GOOD.
author: Jacklyn L.

description: Very cute and dainty location also very quick and efficient service. Not to mention their breakfast was simple yet bomb! Definitely would recommended a friend can't wait to go again (: Also, they have art posted on their walls from local artists that are for sell it is great that they support local artist like that and help get their work and name out there!
author: Darlyne M.

description: It's a good standard breakfast place. Nothing fancy or crazy but just good food. It's small and cute with a friendly staff.
author: Stefanie K.

description: Totally pleased with this place for breakfast. We've waited in line before but it was just taking too long to get in. While we are fans of Mama's on Washington, this was a great place to stop since the wait was not very long. The menu has so many delicious and hearty offerings. The service was fast and friendly. I highly recommend the French toast with fruit. The coffee was robust and not the least bit bitter.
author: Carla W.

description: I was not impressed with this place at all. You can not substitute any thing. My friend ordered the breakfast burrito and asked if the salsa was on the inside of the burrito or outside of the burrito? The waitress reassured him that it was on the outside. He went to explain that he absolutely hates onions that's why he asked. When the burrito got to the table. He took a bite and found four onions and salsa on the inside. When we told the waitress she said sorry took the plate to see if the cooks could make him a new one. My plate was eggs that were under cooked and my thin slice of ham was over cooked.
author: Yolanda O.

description:
Lovely little breakfast find in North Beach just off Columbus in San Francisco. So glad Yelp directed us to this spot and we avoided the hour-long-wait-outside-of-a-pretentious-breakfast-place gig. Yay Pat's and yay Yelp.

Pat's is a down home little restaurant north of a diner and slightly south of a fancy breakfast spot with favorites from omelettes and eggs, pancakes, waffles and lots of things in between. Ultimately went with an old California favorite, Joe's special which didn't disappoint.

Sampled the California omelette from across the table which was cheesy and delicious.

Agree with some of the previous commenters that even though they are corralled by a red-vest-wearing Pat, the staff seems a bit lackluster and because I wanted decaf wound up eating my breakfast without a 2nd cup of coffee.

Definitely give this place a try.
author: Bob K.

description:
I can't find fault with any element of Pat's Cafe. The people waiting on us were genuinely friendly & helpful. The food was superb. I had the Eggs Blackstone, my wife had the shrimp crepes, and both dishes were just about perfect. Even the serving size was spot on. I left there fat and happy, not stuffed and miserable. And Pat herself was on hand to make sure everything was right. If I had one criticism, it's that Pat is a cat person, but the dog lover in me was able to overlook this one shortcoming.   ; )
Eat at Pat's. Dog lover approved.
author: Robert S.

description: This place is great! I had pancakes with fruit and a hot chocolate and thoroughly enjoyed both of them. The staff was friendly and the place was clean. The service was a little bit slow but that's to be expected with how many people they have in there. As an extra bonus they had zero problems with my service dog! I thought that the prices were fair and overall I would recommend this.
author: Murphy H.

description: great service and staff friendly and welcoming! food is very delicious and fulfilling
author: Richard B.

description: Great food and great service. I had the classic benedict and it was the best I've had in North Beach. We also tried the California omelette and were very impressed. Thanks Pat! We'll be back!
author: Sam B.

description: Food here was pretty average... I've eaten at 2 other places (8am cafe and Hollywood cafe) around the area and the quality of food and service were much better for the same price. At least for me, I'd rather eat better food for the same price
author: Stephanie K.

description: Came in at 8am on a Wednesday and it was pretty empty.  Had good service, plenty of food, and the prices were decent for the location and amount of food.  No complaints.
author: Matt T.

description: This is our favorite breakfast spot in town. Pat is so friendly and really, just makes me miss my grandma! :) The food is always fresh and hot, and the coffee is bottomless. The mugs are great, too - good old classic cafe mugs, we may have to ask to buy one next time we visit. There is usually a line on weekends, but they move people in quickly and the service doesn't feel rushed at all. We look forward to breakfast so much when weave Pat's on the agenda!
author: Andrea C.

description: Elevensies San Francisco style. Very good thank you. Yelp is telling me I need to say more! Service was excellent. English breakfast tea was very good & believe me I've struggled to find good tea.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Really delicious breakfast and my favorite was The American Omelet.
Great atmosphere and incredible service.
author: Paul L.

description: Great breakfast spot in North Beach! Really accommodating to families.
author: Jo A.

description:
Best part about this place was that they serve breakfast pretty late. 

My sister and I shared a delicious waffle with strawberries and Nutella. We also ordered the chilaquiles American style. The green sauce they put on top is yummy, it tasted very similar to my homemade sauce
author: Brianna O.

description: The food here is fabulous small place but cozy we actually drove 45 minutes just to come and have breakfast here we ate here when we arrived (11 days ago)and we loved it and we said we were going to come back before we leave one of the very few places you see the owner here working as an employee wiping down tables and so.
author: Jaime G.

description: My absolute favorite spot for breakfast/brunch in SF. Such a mom and pop family place, but kept very clean and nice with art from people in the city. Perfect for the family or a chill spot with the boyfriend/girlfriend for breakfast/lunch. My favorite is the biscuit and gravy (haven't found a better spot to get this), Nutella crapes, French toast or chocolate chip pancakes. This place is ALWAYS packed and busy. The staff is incredible - always moving, never see them standing still - cleaning, busing or filling up water at tables. The food arrives very quickly. Honestly, best spot in town. HUGE FAN. 5 stars all the way around.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Visiting from out of town and not sure where to take your family? Go here! Big portions. Mom & Pop shop. Quality food. 
We ordered too much, but ate it all anyway.
The home fries were the best!! 
This was our favorite place in San Francisco and we had at least 10 restaurants under our belt.
author: Tianna D.

description:
This is a really nice place located near the wharf in San Francisco. While walking around the area, I came across this gem on a local street. 

The restaurant is small and almost has a country look/feel to it. The service is friendly and the vibe is very laid back. I grabbed a seat by the window, which turned out to be awesome as it offers a little privacy and allows you to see the whole restaurant. 

I had the French toast which was good, sausage which was also good, and some home fries which were good but almost cold. Not sure if they had the home fries sitting out or what, but that was a bit disappointing.

Home fries temperature aside, the food here was very good and the country/cafe vibe about the place is definitely fitting for having a Saturday morning breakfast. It definitely gets crowded after 11am, so keep that in mind when coming here. All in all though, a cool spot.
author: Kevin M.

description: The French toast special was very underwhelming and over priced. I've had way better French toast with more eggs and better sausage than what I payed for. The service was inattentive having to repeatedly ask for water and the check and they didn't ask how the food was or how we were. My wife's California omelet was the only saving grave for 2 stars but that's not being as hard. Definitely a pass.
author: Steven A.

description:
Had brunch at Pat's and am amazed at it's current 4 star rating. 
Service: When asked about recommendations, the server did nit provide anything aside from broad generalizations (all of our benedicts are good or our omelettes; it's up to you). 
Food: I had researched and was happy to find that SF's brunch scene is great. I was even happier to see Pat's Yelp rating! Unfortunately, food lacked flavor and finesse; coffee had a burnt flavor that was incredibly difficult to mask with cream or sugar. Even as what I consider to be a "mom and pop" shop, the food was underwhelming ... by a lot.
General: Place looked clean and was full (of tourists and that should have been my red flag). All in all, I suggest finding another place.
author: J R.

description: Omg!!! This place is so good!!! We are visiting and kids were getting hangry so we popped in here on the way to Fishermans Wharf. So glad we did because my quinoa salad was superb, hubby burrito was outstanding and kids crepes were wonderful!!!
author: valerie f.

description: Really awful service. I went with my dad for a nice breakfast but it was just terrible. The food tasted like something I could have made at home but like I could have made it better to be perfectly honest. Way too overpriced for what it was. The service was so freaking bad I ordered grits with my meal and I had to ask the guy three times to bring them before he actually brought them. The grits were good though so it was all good. This guy literally payed zero attention to us the entire time. He just sat at the bar on his ass when we were trying to get our water glasses refilled and stuff. It was overall a bad experience.
author: Kayle R.

description:
Nice breakfast place. Nothing fancy.

The food was ok. 
The service was very good, the waiter was smiling and happy, which is pleasant.

Well located amongst many other bad/touristy breakfast places around.
author: Fa R.

description: Walked here from our hotel, super close location!  LOVED this place!  Friendly service, great food, very homey feeling.  Definitely recommend!  And prices were super reasonable for SF!!!
author: Farinaz B.

description:
A friend of mine recommended Pats to our group of four for breakfast before we explored the city. It was pretty empty at 10am on a Tuesday. The waiter promptly brought us coffee and water while we looked over the menu. My friend recommended the Salmon scramble, which was really great. I ordered the California Crepes. When the man from the kitchen came out with our dishes, he simply held them out to us but didn't specify what they were or who they were for. It was pretty confusing but we quickly figured it out. My California crepes did not come with any avocado as advertised, but were still pretty good otherwise (there was also no difference in price or warning, but I was too hungry to bring it to their attention). Potatoes were done well. My friends enjoyed their meals, including the sourdough bread. 

Nothing super special about this place, but a really solid place to sit down and have a meal.
author: Jordan Z.

description: Amazing breakfast! I am choose Pat's Hash, and my wife take California Omelet, it's was delicious and tasty!
author: Rinat B.

description: This is now our new favorite place for breakfast when in San Francisco. The eggs Benedict are amazing! The staff is very friendly and the owner personally comes to your table to check on you. A great bonus, they are walking distance from The Wharf. I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a great breakfast. It's small, but worth the wait.
author: Elena M.

description: Our favorite breakfast place in San Francisco! Small and cute, great atmosphere. Amazing food every time! Great variety of foods to choose from. Very kid friendly
author: Katy M.

description: I have had brunch in more than 20 places in SF and Pat's is in my top five list. It's cozy, fast and delicious. If you go during the weekend, don't miss the weekend's Benedict specials. They come with hollandaise sauce which is awesome. For weekends, depend on the party size, you may have 15-45 minutes waiting time to be seated, but the area (North Beach) is nice to walk!
author: Ahmadreza K.

description: This is a very pleasant North Beach cafe with friendly and efficient staff.  My daughter works in the neighborhood and heard very complimentary things about Pats so we decided to give it a try.  To be fair, I've only been to Pats once.  On my visit I found the food OK.  My "California Omelette" was over cooked and dry, but My daughter's "Pats Hash" was wonderful.
author: Donna P.

description:
2 tries and I'm not thinking 3rd time will be a charm

Maybe I ordered the wrong thing, but how hard is it to make a grilled sandwich?

1st visit - Breakfast sandwich to go.   Greasy, soggy sandwich and undercooked bacon.  
Grease all over both sides of sandwich -- you'd need about a dozen napkins to get through it. Breakfast potatoes that came with it also undercooked.

2nd visit - Patty melts to go -- SUPER greasy onions, added to the bottom of sandwich, so the whole thing was swimming in a pool of grease, which almost went through the container. Really gross - bf got sick after eating it.  Tried to pick it up the whole sandwich and it fell apart from the grease soaking into the bread - couldn't be eaten.   

3rd visit - Omelet - hard, overcooked eggs.   The test of any breakfast establishment - a perfect scrambled egg -- fail.
author: Audrey E.

description:
Amazing food followed by amazing service!! Edwin and team are amazing, I couldn't even finish my coffee without it being refilled. 

The food was epic, very fresh a an healthy. Mimosa yes!!!! I had the San fam omelette and it was delightful. 

The service provided by Edwin matched the wailing of food. Great job Edwin!!

Pats cafe is a must stop for a nice quit mom and pop breakfast!
author: Christopher B.

description: Everything you have read about this place is true. The food is good, the service is quick, and the prices are reasonable. My son who is a breakfast aficionado, says that the pancakes are a 9.5 out of 10 on his scale. And he has eaten a lot of pancakes! There never seems to be too much of a line, and we were able to eat multiple meals here during our trip. We have tried several different breakfast places, and this one is at the top of the list. Absolutely loved the peanut burtter chocolate chip pancakes!! Service is friendly, and they are always helpful and willing to get you anything that you need. Pat was there on the trips that we made (in her signature red vest), and she does a great job communicating with customers and making everyone feel welcome. It might seem like it's in an out of the way location, but it keeps crowds (of mostly tourists) down and it's worth the walk from wherever you are staying.
author: Michael T.

description: Very nice ambiance for weekdays ... weekends just too busy and crowded. Excellent food !
author: Florinda R.

description: Just had brunch here with a friend on. Sunday morning. There was just two of us and it was probably about a 20-30 minute wait. It's a very cozy, home style cafe, the kind you feel is ran by a welcoming grandmother in her kitchen. I ordered the crab cake Benedict and it was pretty tasty and super filling. I could barely finish it and I usually eat a decent amount of food. I also had a mimosa. It's nice they offer brunch cocktails, too. We had the window table and it was nice out, so it was great. Super friendly servers! Would return.
author: Marie D.

description: As someone who works in the neighborhood, I have a love/hate relationship with Pat's. I love Pat's Hash (and some of the other breakfast dishes), though sometimes the service is slow while other times the food is undercooked. Stick with breakfast items and you'll be ok.
author: John F.

description: Pat's Cafe is a relaxing, cozy place with great food. We had the California omelette and the French toast & both were so yummy!  We sat in the front window & watched the cable cars go by.
author: Paula O.

description: My first time at Pat's. I love it here! The food was delicious! I had the smoked salmon eggs Benedict. The best breakfast I have ever had! The coffee was also great!  Well worth the wait. If you want a wonderful tasting breakfast then this is the place for you.
author: E O.

description:
I had the day off so I came here on a weekday morning. The place was not crowded at all, so my friend and I were seated right away.

Weird dining experience.. not sure why my napkin looked like it was used already. And when my friend and I began to suspect the kitchen had forgotten about our order, we asked the server about it and she said she would go see what's going on. But she was pleasant and made sure everything else was fine.

I ordered the breakfast burrito (choice of meats: ham or chorizo) which was nothing special. It tasted a little too cheesy. But now that I'm thinking about it, I'm sure any other choice from their menu would've made my breakfast experience better. They have a ton of different options, which I wish I would have tried instead. Like the eggs benny, waffles, biscuits and gravy, or the French toast. 

Order took a little too long, especially taking into consideration the few people dining in. But it could be that our order was skipped by accident-totally okay, it happens. I think I have to retry this place on a different day and order something else.
author: Meghan J.

description:
So good! And, for the area, very well-priced. It's a teeny-tiny little spot that's a few blocks from the wharf, but it's worth checking out, especially if you're tired of the touristy stuff and the prices that come with it.

The banana-granola pancakes were probably the best pancakes I've ever had. Eggs were flavorful and the bacon was cut thick, so much to like at this little spot. The service was prompt and friendly, a great way to start your day.

Hollywood Cafe also has great ratings, but that came with almost an hour wait. Skip that crap and come here, where we were seated in about five minutes. It's worth it. My only complaint is that the space is very small, so prepare to be close to people and a little tight -- we got to (unfortunately) hear the entire conversation of the couple next to us, where a guy was talking about how he read, on his cell phone, about how cell phones are making people dumber.

Breakfast = great. Service = awesome. Show = ehhhhhhhh, haha.
author: Alex B.

description:
Hats off to Pat!

I have no idea how this happened, but Pat's Cafe has been in North Beach for 14 years and I, the breakfast junkie, had never eaten there until today! Well, thank goodness that the 14 year  string came to an end! The cafe serves one heck of a breakfast and brunch! Their coffee is good, very good; that by itself is worth one to two stars if you ask me! I tried the California Omelette today and that was also very good! Where had I been all these years?! 

I must say, I also like the setup. The space is nicely arranged and the staff are very friendly (another star for that!). I think due to the fact that the cafe is so close to the Cable Car stop people get the impression that it is a tourist trap. Lots of tourists may frequent the place, but believe me this place is no tourist trap.

Loved it and will definitely visit again.
author: Afshin A.

description:
I knew I wouldn't like this place when I walked it, but let me explain ......

Customer service is #1 for me, I don't care what your food taste like. If your service is bad, then everything goes down. 

We were seated in the very back right next to the kitchen. Now I don't wanna play the race game here but there were plenty of seats up front and in the middle of the cafe, why place us all the way in the back?

The servers walk by us plenty of times and at one point I was staring at them for a minute, while they stared out the window as if they were waiting for customers. I'm hello you have 4 over here.

Another thing, if I have had enough time to review your whole menu and decide on my drinks and meal before you arrived to greet us, I have a problem. 

The 3 of my 4 party stated their food was okay,  mine was not.
author: Danielle C.

description: Awesome SF breakfast place. Delicious food, friendly service and lots of caffeine!!  Family all enjoyed their pancakes for breakfast. Regular, chocolate chip, and fruit. Awesome
author: Scott O.

description:
Meh. Came here for brunch and it barely hit the "ok" mark. The tables along the wall are so close to each other that even a small person (I'm barely over 120lbs) couldn't scoot between the tables if you needed to get up. Props to our friendly table neighbors who moved their table back to help me out. 

My husband and I both ordered benedicts. His was completely wrong and had to go back. Mine was fine except they forgot the hollandaise sauce. Luckily poaching eggs moves fast as my husband's meal was back out in a few minutes. As for our friendly neighbors, the gal's meal was also all wrong, and when it came back out, the avocado in her omelette was brown. 

The food was good but the experience could've been substantially better.
author: Erin B.

description:
We came here for breakfast on a Sunday around 10 and had no problem getting seated.  It is a cute, casual, cozy breakfast place.

I had the blueberry pancakes which were pretty incredible.  They were fluffy and definitely plumped full of blueberries.  They were so delicious that I ate most of them with only a little bit of butter.  I also had a side of grits with cheese.  I would pass on this item next time as it was a bit to watery for me, but it was a huge portion.

By the time we left, there was a line waiting for tables so I would suggest getting here a little early if you can.
author: Lauren H.

description:
I wouldn't miss a chance to grab my breakfast when I'm in San Francisco! 
I absolutely love the "Go Wild" option for my Pancakes and the California Omelet are my most favorite! Don't miss this spot if you happen to visit the city.
author: Pavithra N.

description:
Best Eggs Benedict I've ever had!

We Loved:
1. The fresh ingredients: flavorful hollandaise sauce and fresh ham.
2. Potatoes: crispy and seasoned on the outside and soft on the inside.
3. Coffee: strong with refills 
4. Ambiance: cute small cafe with great window seating or outdoor seating to people watch
5. Reasonably priced

Feedback:
1. Service is slow
2. The to-go coffee they gave me tasted unlike the one at the table. Like day old coffee

Yelp Tip:
1. Look at the menu before and order your drinks and food as soon as you sit. Otherwise expect to be there all day
author: Joy M.

description: Food and service is decent. This is a great spot for standard breakfast fare. The prices are also pretty great considering how expensive SF food can be!
author: Daniella B.

description: Soooo goood! Such a cute little spot, my bf and I were riding around looking for some good breakfast and stumbled upon these guys. Can't go wrong here!
author: Rachel L.

description: Such a small but cute restaurant! The service was pretty fast for how packed it was. The food was great. I'd definitely recommend the French toast. The servers made sure we had everything we needed. I'd definitely go back when given the chance and possibly try the waffles!
author: Kelsea R.

description: Pat's Cafe is a true San Francisco institution and it got to be that way because of its fantastic food, quality service staff and all-around good vibes. We can't say enough good things about it. But we can start by saying that their eggs Benedict are off the charts with hollandaise sauce to write home about. The home fries are fantastic as well. Be sure to say hi to Pat who puts in long days to make her little restaurant so special. It's so special, in fact, that people come from all around the globe to eat her food.
author: L M.

description: I really enjoyed this spot. Nice people and good food. We didn't wait at all since we got there before it got busy. Very tight so expect to be a bit uncomfortable. Didn't like the sausage but that's just me. I would definitely come back and explore the menu.
author: Miguel C.

description: We enjoyed a delicious breakfast at this cute little cafe. We went on a sat morning around 11:30am, didn't have to wait and sat right down. The service was very personable and friendly. We tried the Blackstone, and the Egg Croissant Sandwich with a cappuccino, a cranberry mimosa, and coffee. Everything tasted amazing. Would highly recommend if you are in the San Francisco area!
author: Shawna G.

description: Bloody Mary was soooo good! Crab cake Benny was to die for! Only complaint is the hollandaise sauce could use a little tweaking. Cutest little place! Amazing staff! Highly recommend!!
author: Kelly O.

description: The banana and granola pancake was pretty good, the Potatoes were seasoned with flavorful seasoning, the chiliquilas were not really impressive and reminded us of egg nachos, but overall it was ok.
author: Noname W.

description:
As my Girlfriend and I were in San Francisco this past weekend, we woke up one morning and wanted to have breakfast some place different.  We wanted something not touristy and somewhat off the beaten track.  My Girlfriend found this hidden local gem via Yelp.  My recommendation is to try this location at least once.  You won't be disappointed.  

It's small, quaint, homey, and serves awesome food like your Mom use to make you.  We both had omelets and coffee.  We were so glad that we found this location!

If your a local or a tourist, then you have to eat here!
author: Manny S.

description: Such a cute place for breakfast/ brunch! Workers are very helpful and kind. The food is extraordinary! It's not your typical chain restaurant. This can be crowded but definitely worth it. There is Wifi so that's a big plus. Located in a nice area, not sketchy whatsoever. Definitely recommend stoping here while in town
author: Sara M.

description:
I have traveled the globe in my Holy Grail quest for the perfect pancakes.....Aruba, Toronto, Bavaria Germany, Constantinople, Ho Chi Minh, Rio De Jinero.....they all have wonderful concoctions in their own right. But here.... here in a quaint hole in the wall called Pat's in San Francisco California.....they may make the most interesting pancakes in the world....

Now, I don't always order pancakes, but when I do....I may just prefer Pat's banana granola pancakes. Stay hungry, my friends.

The other cool vibe about this place, besides the kickass pancakes, is the awesome vibrant, acid trippy yellows, reds and oranges which surround you. Livens up your day a bit....we all could use a splash of color. And, again, it is a mom and pop shop, which my home state of Maryland so desperately needs. I love traveling, partly cuz I get to experience the little guys like this. I also bought one of the photography prints hanging on the wall from a local, amature craftsman. It had the view of the city I so wished I could capture on my simple $240 smart phone.

Good food, good atmosphere, good service....5 stars.
author: Zachary W.

description: It was really good. Loved the steak and eggs and fruit crepes... Staff was really friendly. Felt like home. If ever in North shore make sure u stop by Pats Cafe...
author: Sandy B.

description: I went to this place for the first time and absolutely loved it! Cozy, fresh food and great service. You may have to wait for a little while to be seated, but it's worth it!
author: Angie's M.

description: Great food and service! Definitely worth the wait to get a table during the Saturday morning rush.
author: Matt A.

description: I finally got to experience a true "Joe's Special Scramble"! I've made this dish b4 for my Georgia family, and on my recent trip to SF, stumbled into this little colorful gem on the early morning of my departure and was thrilled to see it on their menu. The server - nice, quick and attentive - didn't know what I was talking about when I gushed about the origins of the dish and how me, a Southern gal, was so excited to have the real thing, but that's OK. The food was amazing, and I'm so glad that I found Pat's rather than settling for crummy airport food.
author: Ticia B.

description: My wife and I were staying in SF for the weekend, just a few blocks away from Pat's.  Found the cafe on Google and decided to try it.  We were blown away.   Food was AMAZING.  We had the regular pancakes and also the peanut butter pancakes.   So good!  Atmosphere is great too.   Staff were so polite with smiles all around.  We decided to go again the following morning.   We couldn't wait to go!   Will be our place to eat breakfast (although I'm sure they serve a great lunch too) in our future trips to SF.
author: Paul E.

description: This place is reeal GOOD! Staff is quick and friendly. The food is so goood and the portions are just right. We sat at the corner table by the window which made it so much better. Loved the deco. Definetly will come back and i recommend it. Great location. Btw love the watermelon garnish. Great touch.
author: Clo C.

description:
Seems like it does not matter which day you visit, this place has their usual customers + tourists like us :) So as soon as you walk in, reach to list to put your name and do not get far from the scene :) Or your name will be crossed. That's fair though. We got lucky with 2 seats at the bar after 15 minutes await. Meanwhile you can check the photographs on walls which are for sale. 

We ordered our coffees right away. Coffee cups were a bit stained, but their being branded was cute. We then asked for an eggs florentine and a burrito, on Sunday, took about 40-45 minutes. We did not mind waiting since we are on vacation but if rushing, you can ask for an estimated serving time. Eggs Florentine ! Deliciouss! Their home-made sauce is so good and eating whole dish, you feel like " hell yeah, I made a favor for myself today " :)

Pat seems as a nice lady even we did not have a chance to meet. I loved her red earrings she had on :) She has her eye on everything going on around and I'm sure that's the key to success. Hope to visit again when we are in SF.
author: Ceren A.

description: Pat's Cafe never disappoints! The food is fresh, generous portions, and a very reasonable price. You're not breaking the bank here...especially with our family of six. The staff is friendly and ALWAYS provide excellent customer service.
author: Janeane V.

description:
If you can't stomach the wait for the acclaimed Hollywood Cafe, do make the trek out to Pat's Cafe for some simple and delicious food. The service staff is very friendly and there's also free WiFi!

Their hot chocolate is absolutely amazing because they use Ghiradelli chocolate. Now for the food:

Joe's Special: It's pretty much a breakfast scramble, with eggs, ground beef, spinach, mushrooms and onions. Ingredients were very fresh but this breakfast entree didn't blow me away taste-wise. The garlic toast was surprisingly good!(3.5/5 stars)

Eggs on Toast: On toast? The eggs were pretty much inside the toast. The egg was delicious but the toast was a bit dry. Sausage links were overcooked a little too much for my personal liking. (3/5 stars).

If you can't wait for Hollywood's massive line and feel ashamed to eat brunch at Denny's or the other 2000 corporate chain restaurants near Fisherman's Wharf, Pat's Cafe will not leave you disappointed.
author: Philip M.

description:
There is clearly history at Pat's cafe. And I appreciate it for it, I truly do. There is that good old smell of breakfast that overwhelms your senses the moment you walk in. This place doesn't stand out in any sense other than it's "normalness". And I mean that in the best way possible. Although you will find a man bun or two at Pats, this is an establishment with an old soul, old, non-pretentious receptors and satisfying menu. 

My only negative mark is the service. The young fellows are very nice and friendly, and very responsive when you reach it and ask for their attention...but unless you as a customer do that step, you will be waiting...and waiting and waiting and waiting. It took 10 mins for someone to take my order. It's not something that will keep me from coming back here in the future, but staff attentiveness and anticipation are definitive areas for improvement.
author: Matija A.

description:
I've eaten here 3-4 times because I really did want to like it... food is excellent but the service is so terrible I won't be going back. They are rude, mess up orders, simply skip you after you've had your name on the list to be seated... I could go on and on about the terrible service.

It's too bad, really, because the food is good. This place simply does not care about you and make it very apparent they could careless.
author: Emily C.

description: Very good breakfast. Nice little mom and pop cafe. Huge servings. Come hungry. Everything looked yummy.
author: Joey N Carey P.

description:
We stopped by here for a quick bite to eat on our way up to Muir Woods. I think we hit that golden spot on a Saturday morning where people are still in bed nursing Friday night off, regardless at 8:45 in the morning we were able to grab a seat in the back. However, 20 minutes later the place was packed!

We ordered two coffees and split the corned beef hash and California crepe. Both portions were generous without encouraging obesity. Loved the flavor on their corned beef and house potatoes. California crepe had applewood chicken sausage, sauteed onions, cheddar cheese and avocados. It was flat out delicious (it does normally come with mushroom but I don't dig on fungus).

Service was prompt and attentive.
Simple food done right and great service. Really that is all I ask for in a meal.
author: Rebecca T.

description: On vacation in San Francisco and was looking for a great place to have breakfast with my family. I went on yelp and read great reviews on this place, it didn't disappoint. Place is small and cozy, people are friendly and food delicious. It's inexpensive.I totally recommend this place
author: Corina B.

description:
Chose Pat's for breakfast on our recent stay in San Francisco because it was right around the corner from our hotel and Yelp reviews seemed promising. 

The fruit crepes were delicious! Probably the best I've ever had. Served with plenty of fresh fruit and whipped cream.  Also had a side of home fries, not sure what the seasoning was but they were a bit spicy for me. I am a spice wimp though. So maybe for the normal person, they would have been fine. 

If I had to complain about something, it would be that the server seemed to be working solo. And while the food came out rather quickly, I had to chase him down to get my check from him when we were done with our meal. I think the poor gentleman could have used some help.
author: Jill B.

description: I love coming here! It's super eccentric and there are several unique paintings of the city (made by local artists and are for sale)! The food comes quick, and even when it's super busy there is never a long wait for a table. I have had a few different breakfast and lunch items here, and they never disappoint.
author: Jenny H.

description: Kiddos and I wanted a reasonably priced breakfast close to our hotel on the wharf that had good pancakes, this was the place! Kids had pancakes with bacon and eggs and I had Pat's hash. The portions were huge and price was similar to what I would pay in Denver at la place like the pancake house. Food came out fast which was good since my kids were really hungry. They are pancake lovers and said these were very good and corn beef was tasty and had nice big chunks. Definitely recommend!
author: Diana S.

description:
Pat's not my typical breakfast place that I would go to (I don't spend that much time in North Beach/Fisherman's Wharf), but it has a west coast American breakfast feel to it (not to be confused with those New Jersey/New York diners). I came here with four of my relatives (who are not from the US) to show them a more traditional American breakfast. 

FOOD: I got the Mexican omelet and found it to be quite tasty. The slight bits of chorizo and bell peppers peppered throughout the omelet. Pretty basic, but executed well. 

Honestly, Pat's location is what makes this place. The food itself was decent, but it is what you would expect of a traditional breakfast place. 

Also, decent vegetarian options as my relatives were vegetarian. Kudos for Pat's for keeping in mind non-meat eaters!
author: Albert H.

description: Ordered from doordash just now and the pancakes and eggs were probably the worst I've ever had. The bacon was bearable, but what does that really say?
author: Barry H.

description:
This is by far my favorite breakfast and brunch place in SF. I've since moved to another city, but I make sure every time I come back I go eat at Pat's. 

You'll recognize the place by the cutout of Pat standing in front of the diner. When you walk in, you'll be pleasantly surprised to find that Pat actually wears the same outfit as in the cutout.

I highly recommend the eggs benedict or eggs blackstone :)
author: Eduardo Y.

description: Nice place to start your day with . I ordered the griled chicken omelette it was very delicious and it comes with very good potatoes . The dishes sizes were very good .
author: Talal A.

description: Absolutely loved Pat's Cafe!  My wife and I had a delicious breakfast and some mimosas .  The egg burrito with chorizo and the California crepe were divine!
author: David H.

description: Nice place to have a good breakfast. Really quick service. BAD coffee for a restaurant so close to North Beach.
author: J A.

description:
I was on a long search for breakfast and I was starting to get annoyed waiting line after line, but I got to Pat's and I was happy to be seated within a couple of minutes in a colorful place with local photography for sale.
Everyone is so kind and tentative! And the food was so perfect! Filling and inexpensive. I thought two pancakes wouldn't be enough, but it was more than enough!!! And the two eggs on the side! Just cute delicious little place.
author: Abby L.

description: Tried this place for breakfast while visiting SF. The food was all fantastic. I especially enjoyed the eggs benedict. We also saw some of the items on the lunch people other tables had ordered and it all looked really delicious and fresh. The service was mediocre at best though so that was a bit of a bummer. I would probably give them another chance if I lived in the area.
author: Sarah M.

description:
A very good breakfast spot.  Eggs to order, all the usual fare, and a couple of unexpected options.  I ordered two eggs over medium with a side of bacon.  ALso came with sour dough toast and home fries.  A super filling breakfast to start of a day of hill climbing.  
It's slight off the beaten path but very close to the fisherman's wharf end of the cable car.
author: Randy M.

description: Absolutely delicious food, great customer service, I got the chocolate chip pancakes an egg and bacon, and some coffee, it was all top notch  in a gorgeous neighborhood as well
author: Tim A.

description: Delicious hole in the wall cafe in North Beach. Easy street parking and friendly staff, highly recommend!
author: Isabel A.

description: Ambiance of this cafe is perfect for the location. Pat and her staff were on point to make sure all customers are acknowledged and aware of the queue. I had the blueberry pancakes with Nutella and strawberries . I wanted to lick my plate it was so good, but one does not do such things in civilized society. HIGHLY RECOMMEND this place.
author: Kristal G.

description:
Normally not the area we would go to for breakfast but since we wanted to hang out by the pier, we decided to check this place. This place wasn't crowded on a Saturday morning. 
Service was good and they were understanding with my little one. 
I got the crab benedict... sauce was good, potatoes had rosemary which I love.
Husband got the corned beef hash which was a little dry.
Coffee was good too. 
If you're around the area, it's a nice place to go to.
author: Claire J.

description: I have been here a few times and not only I like the food but they're also very nice with accommodating my big stroller and my baby. I really like that the owner is so personable with her clients seems that she has something nice  going on
author: Selene M.

description: Right below the famous Lombard zig zag this is a conveniently located spot with great breakfast options. I had the spinach omelet which was so fresh and delicious. My husband had eggs and pancakes which were done perfectly. Their breakfast potatoes have a Cajun seasoning that we didn't care for, but otherwise this was a great breakfast with friendly service. Coffee is good too!
author: Kendra J.

description: Loved Pat's for breakfast on an earlier trip to San Francisco. Went back to try again.  Great food, large omelette. Don't be in a hurry.  There will be a wait.  Bit worth it. We'll be back.
author: Jack S.

description:
Yes, yes, YES! Talk about exactly what I want every time I go out for brunch. This place is small, service is slow, and it's popular- so be warned that if you're on a time constrant it's not the way to go. Even so, if you have some time to lazily sip on your coffee while eating some of the best brunch foods you can imagine, Pat's Cafe is where it's at. 

A few of the highlights: 
- The crab cake eggs benedict was amazing. As good as you can imagine the combination of those two foods, it's even better. 
-The french toast is made of sour dough bread slices. It's more amazing than you can imagine. 
-Service when we went and needed a table for 6 was slow, almost non-existant to a frustrating level. However, the quality and taste of the food made up for the long wait in my book. 

I will definitely be back to try more of their food the next time I'm in town. 5 stars for food, 3 for service = 4 overall.
author: Melinda R.

description: After 6 hours of driving coming here was a great pick, People here are so nice. Refilled our coffee and asked how were doing if we needed anything else :) Had a wonderful breakfast with my family.
author: Raeann R.

description: Great place for breakfast if you are near Fisherman's Wharf. Had the banana granola pancakes - yum. Awesome coffee, cozy shop...nice artwork of the area, friendly owners. Would definitely stop here again.
author: Shannon C.

description:
Loved this diner style cafe, but nicer. NOT a greasy spoon place Busy at 11am so I seated myself at the bar. Brewed coffee was really hot and delish!  Pancake Special was fresh, generous and tasty. Two fluffy pancakes with a lightly scrambled egg and two thick smoky pieces of bacon.  

Located near Lombard crooked part so I will never forget how to get there. Only reason I didn't give the place a 5 Star? Oh, haha, couldn't think of a reason NOT to so I did!!
author: Karen J.

description:
Lovely small place with warm and welcoming interior. Great food, freshly made and cooked to order.
It is a perfect breakfast location. Not only because of the great service which is kind and fast, but also for the physical location in a short walking distance to the piers and Fisherman's Wharf.
They probably serve lunch as well, I'm not sure about it since we came in and asked only about breakfast. If they do serve other menus I'm sure it must be good as well.
author: Stephanie A.

description: Very nice local cafe. Crab cakes are delicious. Service is excellent.  And next to cable cars as a bonus attraction.
author: Gordon P.

description: Really quaint place for breakfast. Food was good. Had the California omelet with home fries. The service was very friendly and Pat came around and greeted everyone. We would come back if in the area again
author: Scott B.

description:
It almost an hour after we were seated and ordered and our food still hadn't come out. The woman working the register could not get the bills straight. This added to the wait. 

We witnessed another patron send her food back and it did not come back. They finally asked about their food and the waiter brought it back; it was cold and it was not fixed as they had ordered it.

I finally had to tell the waiter to pack our food to go because the extended wait made us late to our appointment. This was breakfast! There is no reason for pancakes, omelettes, and bacon to take an hour!

Don't eat here if you actually want to get your food and eat it. Terrible service and total apathy to its patrons.
author: Jonas J.

description:
For a hole in the wall local breakfast spot...this place hits the spot. Nothing is out of a can or made from powder like the chain breakfast places. 

Pat's Cafe was a mix between old school diners and a local eatery. It seems that the Cafe kept true to its roots and has some amazing food choices. 

I orders the Pat's Hash with sourdough toast (I mean we are in San Francisco after all). Hash came out with an assortment of sautéed veggies and tasted as good as it looks. Worth a visit if you are trying to stay away from the tourist traps!

Thanks for the amazing breakfast!
author: Amin Z.

description: Best burger we have ever had! All the employees were supper friendly, service was fast, food fresh and great atmosphere! Highly recommend.
author: Elicia P.

description: We had brunch here over the weekend and it was amazing. The service was a little slow and no one greeted us for about 10 minutes at our table but the food was so good it made up for it. The owner Pat took our order and recommended the French toast so I went with that. You have to try this French toast. It's like the softest piece of bread ever (I think it was sourdough) and the sasauge was also good. Didn't try the salmon eggs Benedict but my friend seemed to like it. Oh - I also tried the pancakes and they were pretty tasty too. So happy to have found a nearby brunch spot without lines around the block!
author: Brittany G.

description: This was a small place. A safe part of town. Original recipes and very pleasant staff. Price was 12.00 for a Denver omelette, delicious. Enjoy.
author: Rich S.

description:
This place was near our hotel by Fisherman's Wharf. We woke up and walked on over after I found it on Yelp. I loved the eggs Benedict with their very own Hollandaise sauce. Simply delicious. Along with their home fries, it was a special breakfast dish. And the coffee in their own Pat's coffee San Francisco mug was so fresh and delicious. 

What a breakfast experience too. Pat herself was there and helped us out. Very warm and friendly. She socializes with all the patrons and really makes you feel like you are visiting her home.
author: Robert V.

description: Had the best breakfast at Pats...great menu and great food. I highly recommend this place!!!
author: Ilene L.

description: Great food! Fruit fresh with our crepes and French toast.  Real maple syrup available which was a huge plus. Staff friendly    Great eclectic feel.   Would come here again
author: Deb P.

description: It was an okay brunch spot. I feel like it is consistent in  quality of food and I like that you're almost always ready to be seated even without reservations. Blueberry pancakes are a dream, the spinach omelette is fine, and the savory crepes are nothing worth writing home about. But if you'd rather wait 2 hours for brunch then you can take yourself elsewhere.
author: Julianne S.

description: Came here from SoCal and was looking for a quick bite in the morning. Found this place on yelp and gave it a try. The food was pretty good, nothing overly special. The service was average as well. I will say their caffe mocha was pretty great and a huge cup for just under $5. There was no wait and it's pretty much seat yourself. Overall a good place for a quick breakfast or lunch.
author: Karlee I.

description: Wonderful food. Wonderful service. Our waiter was very nice and took excellent care of us. The eggs were fresh and perfectly prepared. All the food was very good. We will have breakfast there, again tomorrow.
author: Daniel C.

description:
Charming little mom and pop local cafe!

We popped into Pat's on a Sunday at 10 am without a reservation (I don't think they take them).  A little notepad sits on the front counter and parties are seated in the order they sign into the notepad.  

I noticed several tourists had made their way to Pat's with maps and vacation guides.  I'm glad they found a charming and unique place such as this instead of all the chain garbage at the Wharf!  

After being greeted and writing down our names to be seated, we waited about 5 minutes-- pretty minimal in this city for brunch!  Service was friendly and prompt once we sat down.  Coffee was served while we perused the menu.  

I ordered the crab cake Benedict.  The crab cake was a slightly overcooked but the perfectly poached egg and excellent hollandaise sauce made up for it.  Country-fried potatoes were a nice partner to the dish.  I appreciated that our server was very attentive-- our coffee was refilled 3 times throughout dinner.  

I will definitely be back!  What a great experience.
author: Andrea H.

description: This place was ok... nothing super spectacular. I went on a Saturday morning and it was busy as expected. Didn't have wait too long for a table inside though. They took our orders promptly and quickly and the food came out quick too. The plates were pretty good sized. I wanted an omelette, but was unable to make my own. You have to select one from their preset menu and you cannot make substitutions. Pretty frustrating if you want certain meats or veggies. The omelette was good, but more so a pile of sautéed veggies and meat with an egg patty with cheese on top. Not bad, just different. We had to ask several times for more water and coffee, but other than that all was well. My friend ordered pats scamble or something like that and it looked good. And the other one ordered the corned beef, which comes in cubes.
author: Kristen H.

description: Yum, yum, yum.  First time visit this morning for breakfast/brunch. Delicious eggs in a hole, perfectly cooked with sausage links and fresh fruit cup.  I also had a side order of biscuits and gravy. Everything was the best.  Thank you.  I shall return on my next visit from Portland.
author: Kevin K.

description:
Came here on Sunday before our touristy things to do and had a lovely breakfast. There was an older lady who went around to make sure everyone was fine and all, she was lovely. There was a slight wait before we were seated but it was fine. 

Nice food.
Great owner.
author: Helen A.

description: Went to SF for the weekend, found Pat's Cafe! Great service and food.. would highly recommend this place for a great spot to go have breakfast ...
author: Christina M.

description: This place was phenomenal. *home fries*. The eggs, french toast, pancakes, super crispy bacon and *home fries*, even the oj was so tasty. The inside is super cute and very comfortable, service was top notch and timed perfectly. *home fries*. I love the location( in the way down to Fishermans Wharf area), and that they serve breakfast until 3:00. Those are my kind of hours. *home fries*. Prices are extremely reasonable and portions huge. Really nice local photos on the walls are fun to look at. Again - *home fries*. No need for Mama's - Pat's is definitely the place you want to be.
author: Kate D.

description: I had the crab cake Benedict and it wasn't quite what I was expecting, it was a thin crab patty.. but still tasted good. My coffee mug was dirty but I survived and we didn't really talk to the waiter, he only came by once or twice and could have been more forthcoming with the butter. We had to ask multiple times and he was reluctant to bring out a little cup. The corned beef hash had good flavor, but it was just meat, onions, and peppers. We got a side of potatoes and mixed that together with it, and it was perfect! That's what I suggest for the meal.
author: Liz J.

description: Stopped in Pat's for lunch before doing a trolley tour. The staff was friendly, and we were promptly greeted. The service was quick and pleasant. We weren't in the mood for breakfast food, but the menu was very tempting! I ordered the tuna salad sandwich on sourdough with a side salad, and my husband got the tuna melt on wheat with fries. Both sandwiches were excellent. I especially enjoyed the side salad with apple slices and a tangy dressing. The restaurant is bright and cheerful, and I enjoyed looking at the beautiful photographs on the walls. Pat was telling another patron that business had been slow, and that she sure was hoping it picks up soon. I really hope more locals (and tourists) will visit Pat's Cafe. You won't be disappointed!
author: Susan C.

description: Pat's was amazing! I ordered the California omelet with Sourdough toast ~ Yummy. Service was attentive but not intrusive. It was a chilly morning, but staff kept my coffee topped off and made sure everything was in order. It was crowded, but I was served promptly and well. Definitely recommend this one!
author: Sandy J.

description:
I went alone then was seated and served immediately. I enjoyed the food very much. The Eggs Blackbear, one of their personal favorites, was delicious and filling! It's fair to say that it's one of my favorites now after that meal. They used bacon in place of ham typical of an Eggs Benedict.

The ambience was great, full of life. The waiters made sure I had something to drink while ordering and consistently checked up if I was alright. I truly enjoyed my brunch. 

Just an observation - those in groups are more likely to wait a while before getting seated as opposed to those who go alone like I did.
author: Cam R.

description: Let me tell you about how I wore a camouflage sweater.I must have blended in with the wall or something. My husband and I were in town and turned to Yelp for some suggestions. We were seated and greeted by our waiter right Away. He seemed kinda clueless as to why we were there. Anyway I ordered a Mexican omelette not available for whatever reason. Then I asked about waffles guy said he wasn't sure if he had them . This place is a joke. Everything u order on the menu is either not in stock or sold out. After seeing an older lady in her mid 70'S fret everyone and ask if everything was okay for the last 20 minutes we finally came to the decision she was no where close to greeting us !!. Proudly we are a Hispanic people with a huge "nopal" in our foreheads . We discovered this place isn't color friendly !!! Fuck these people. Prices r stupid dumb . 2 stars because my Pimosa was good.
author: Evelyn L.

description: Breakfast is ok. Nothing over the top. Water from the faucet. Overpriced. My biggest issue was Pat herself. She spoke to absolutely ever table except ours. She walked right by multiple times without any acknowledgement. Maybe I'm crazy but everyone there was white except us. Hm makes me wonder. Food could be bought anywhere but service and good morals are hard to come across.
author: Eddie H.

description:
Arrived on our first day in San Fran.

Has expected a good experience based on reviews but what a disappointment.

The server ignores us when we arrived even thou the cafe was very quiet - eventually we were seated the we waited another 10 to be served.

We ordered a chicken sandwich with two cokes. We then waited again for ages even thou there were less than 8 people in the cafe. When it finally arrived it was generally lacking Chicken but had all the bacon ....

Then we tried to ask for Mayo - it finally arrived after another 10 minutes and others had all had their food order.

Over all my worse US food experience. It was expensive and not worth the cost. It's a pity as it could have been great.

I'd stick to subway or Starbucks who actually care about their customers.
author: Ash T.

description: Went here when Mama's line was too long, based on reviews.  Happy we did!  Short wait, food and service was fantastic!  The eggs Benedict weekend special with homemade h-sauce was amazing.
author: Kory K.

description:
Stopped here for breakfast before I rented a bike to ride over he Golden Gate Bridge. Obviously a cute little local spot, bright colors adorn the outside. Seems to very locally owned, Pat is an actual person and walked in while I was there. My waiter was warm and friendly and there seem to be some locals as well as passers by. 

I ordered an OJ and pats corned beef hash which came with eggs to your liking, some potatoes and your choice of toast (chose the sourdough, obviously). All in all a perfectly good breakfast, healthy portions. The sourdough toast was really good but I couldn't finish all four pieces. The eggs were cooked pretty spot on (over easy). I think the potatoes would have been better off a little more well done.

I think it's a little pricey for a plain old breakfast but I feel like this is the norm in San Fran - and you are paying for the cutesy neighborhood feel.
author: Samantha M.

description: Best brunch place in San Francisco. I used to come here regularly, too bad I had to move to another city! But every time I come back to SF I make sure to stop at Pat's for a nice plate of eggs benedicts and a couple of mimosas. The hollandaise sauce is just amazing!
author: Adriana M.

description: Found this cute little place and we were so surprised there was a table available for us when we got there this morning! It was pouring rain and it was so great to get out of the rain and have a hot breakfast! I had the Nutella crepe and I added bananas it was so worth the 1.75 extra. My boyfriend had the salmon scramble and he was in heaven! I would highly recommend this cute little breakfast joint! The decor and atmosphere is so fun and cute
author: Taylor B.

description:
The coffee in the morning with cream is heaven!!!! 

We passed this place on the way to the fishermans wharf and we were staving at 9am. We sat right in the window and enjoyed breakfast & coffee. 

My gosh was it delicious....

I had a fruit bowl and a side of eggs with coffee and cream and it made my tummy smile. It was just enough food where I did not feel stuffed. 

If we ever visit again I will be there in a heartbeat for the coffee with cream. The cream was so fresh and creamy and it melted into the coffee and left you with a rich flavor. I think I drank 3 cups of coffee because it was that good!!
author: Samantha L.

description: Friendly service and great coffee, but the food was unimpressive (especially for the price). Our server was super nice.
author: Tracy N.

description: Had breakfast at Pat's twice during our weekend in San Francisco.  First morning I had side orders of hash and cheesy grits, my husband had French toast with fruit.  Both delicious.  This morning I had Eggs Benedict, the eggs were very fresh, yolks were high, reminds me to shop local farmers market for eggs.  Hollandaise was rich and wonderful. We were there when they open 7:30ish...no line.  Excellent breakfast, nice wait staff, reasonable prices
author: Sharon B.

description: Great service! We went on a Sunday so we had the brunch menu! Had the best eggs Benedict in my life! They were busy but we didn't wait long and the staff was very prompt. Very good bloody Mary's as well!
author: Tiana A.

description: Very cute atmosphere. The food was very fresh and the service was great. Definitely will revisit upon returning to San Francisco.
author: Jada P.

description: We enjoyed the sourdough french toast  a definite must when visiting San Francisco. Pat's was the best so far! Sat in a cozy bay window enjoyed a delicious cup of coffee as we watch the hustle and bustle of the city. The service was delightful and very accommodating. The cafe is quaint cute and we admired the old pictures that adorned  the walls.
author: M J.

description: Been here twice. Solid American brunch spot. Locally owned. Great  service- everyone has a smile. The food won't knock your socks off, but if you're looking for a good meal and generous portions this is your spot.
author: Amy M.

description: We stumbled upon this place walking towards the wharf. Great find! Excellent food and service, friendly. Nice setting. And normal prices for a change
author: Michael S.

description: the breakfast here was amazing! we ordered a bagel, nutella crepe, and scrambled eggs, and all were fantastic!! the only downside is that we were sat between two crowded tables with not much leg room. other than that the food came very fast, and drinks were amazing too. totally recommend if you're in the downtown san francisco area, near the wharf or north beach.
author: Sophie A.

description:
Banana Granola pancakes are everything! its so delicious.
the service here is a touch slow, but the waiter was painfully adorable and sweet so it makes up for it.
Its also nice and warm in here and the bathrooms are clean, so thats a plus.
author: Ella A.

description: Pretty simple review here:  My girlfriend and I came in on a Friday morning and were promptly seated.  The place was somewhat busy, but not totally packed.  We sat there for 15 minutes without anyone coming over to our table or acknowledging our presence whatsoever.  We had a ferry tour to catch and didn't have time to be sitting around, so we left without being served so much as a glass of water.  I was looking forward to trying to food here because of the positive yelp reviews, but there is no excuse to disrespect your customers like that.  It's one thing to have slow service, and I can understand that.  It's another to completely ignore your patrons.  We ended up getting food at Boudin on the pier instead.
author: Gary M.

description: I enjoyed the breakfast French toast special not sure what type of bread was used a little different twist from the norm which worked for me.  The place is cozy but friendly the prices were in line with the food.  Staff and Pat were very attentive.  I would go back to try other dishes on the menu.
author: Kathy W.

description: We came in for our friend's birthday. The server, the bus boy, the host, were all extremely accommodating. One dish was cold so we sent it back, but they were happy to heat it up for the birthday girl. At the end of the meal, the brought her an amazing crepe with candles on top to wish her a happy birthday. The service alone will bring me back to this place.
author: Danielle H.

description: We ate here after reading several good reviews and a personal recommendation by our hotel front desk clerk.  We were not disappointed...as a matter of fact, we returned every morning during our stay.  It took a while before we placed our order, but once we did order, our food came out quickly.  The california omelet and breakfast burrito were both exceptionally good, and the coffee full flavored.  Will definitely visit Pat's again next time we're in San Francisco.
author: Greg K.

description:
Hands down the best hollandaise I've ever had in my life. Excellent service as well. My wife ordered the hash and it came with assorted bell peppers in it which my wife has a mild allergy to (her lip curls and she sighs excessively). We asked (who we presume the owner to be, who was checking on tables) if we could order something else. 

The new order was rushed out right away and the other dish comp'd. Great service, greats of, great atmosphere. Nothing less than 5 stars here.
author: Ryan S.

description:
This was a few blocks off the tourist strip and do worth the walk. Pats was so welcoming and the food was delicious!! Definitely will be coming back!

GREAT FOOD, great atmosphere and amazing service!
author: Lindsey T.

description: This place rocks a little pricy but it is in north beach the food is outstanding the staff is fun and the bloody Mary's are strong and spicy
author: John W.

description:
I've been here once before- got a breakfast burrito. Mediocre and shitty service.

I assumed it came with salsa, so when my food arrived and it was missing, I asked for some. They charged me.

Was back in town looking at Yelp and saw people rating it nicely, decided to go and realized quick it was a place I'd been. Walked in anyway, a Thursday at 730am, so not a hugely busy time.

So now my actual review: NOPE- don't come here. My huge party of 2 watched as people that came in after us got drinks and enjoyed placing their order. We just sat there, with our menus to the side to let the sever know we were ready to order. He passed us, he made eye contact and continued to walk, I don't know, maybe he internally laughed at not bringing us water or acknowledging us as customer, who knows?

Anyway, we walked out as the guy behind us got to order right in our ears. Since he came in well after us, that was the last straw. Decided to walk over to mama's on Washington square and that was the right decision! Even with the wait, the staff was so kind and friendly and the food demolished pat's.
author: Lacey G.

description: Fun atmosphere, decent service and the food was above average....except for the breakfast potatoes, I wasn't a fan
author: Annie C.
