description: Excellent meal.  Highly recommended!!!   The service was amazing and I highly recommend the Mexican Omlette!  This establishment did not disappoint.
author: J L.

description:
i was originally planning on going to Mama's but it was nearly noon new year's day and just didn't have the patience for the ridiculous line there so we went to Pat's! greatest decision ever

this place is quite small. very colorful. we only waited like 5 minutes to be seated. i ordered the mexican scramble, my bf had the SF omelette i think it was called and my brother had the eggs in a hole. and we had an order of pancakes to share. trust me when i tell you the pancakes are TO DIE FOR. ever since then, my mouth has been watering for those delicious buttery soft pancakes. never have i ever had a better pancake. and i don't even like pancakes that much. i never order pancakes. but i will definitely be coming back probably this weekend for some pancakes. everything else was delicious too, especially the house potatoes they give you. they're very soft yet crispy. just really good.

ALSO they had really good iced coffee which most breakfast cafes don't seem to have, so that's definitely a plus. see you guys this weekend.
author: Lily M.

description: Ate breakfast here on a recent trip. I'm from NYC so hard to impress. But I really enjoyed this place. A varied menu - everything was fresh an well-prepared. Clean, friendly and relaxed. Highly recommend it.
author: Allen B.

description:
We had a terrific experience here this morning. 
I had the smoked salmon benedict, about which everything was excellently done. Eggs beautifully cooked, delicious thinly sliced smoked salmon, way better than average English muffin, and wonderful hollandaise. Unexpected additions that put the dish over the top were arugula and avocado. Served with tasty home fries, it's a must-try. My spousal unit thoroughly enjoyed his California omelette, filled with chicken sausage, avocado, and cheese. Coffee is delicious. The owner oversees all with care, and took the time to chat while pouring us coffee refills. Comfy ambiance. Great spot!
author: michelle g.

description: Great value for money, good food and very friendly staff - ideal place to start the day with a good breakfast!
author: Michael S.

description: Strange smell inside. Awful smell, actually. But, if you stick it out, the Californian crepe and pomegranate juice is spectacular! If it weren't for the smell, I'd probably give it 5 stars. It's something difficult to overlook for most, though.
author: Bethany K.

description:
I would consider this food better than standard diner food. I ordered the mexican omelette and enjoyed it. The chorizo was really good. My only issue with it was that it wasn't really an omelette. The egg part was cooked well and blanketed over the pile of omelette insides. My boyfriend enjoyed his burrito, but made the mistake of eating the entire thing (it is huge!). 

The atmosphere of this little cafe was perfect for what we were looking for. Something that was small and not packed. It is fairly close to the Fisherman's Wharf so I naturally was concerned that it would be crowded. It was not. 

I would recommend this spot for breakfast to anyone staying in the area.
author: Brittany O.

description:
Very down-to-earth place to eat. Walkable distance from The Marriott Hotel (less than 10 min walk)! it was easy to spot, and the bellman from the hotel recommended this place. 

I only got a picture of my meal which was the Pecan Pumpkin Spice Pancakes and they were delicious!! No need for syrup unless you have a big sweet tooth (AKA me) but I initially had tried it without syrup and was satisfied as well. 

I really wish I was from this area, because I would have LOVED to try other items on Pat's menu :) maybe, next time I'm in town!
author: Mallory V.

description:
I came the day before they were supposed to do a remodel, but in case they haven't changed the decor, I would recommend you sit on the right hand side of the restaurant, because then you won't have to stare at a wall filled with photos of ragged 60s hippies doing dope and generally being jobless. 

Overall a good place for breakfast with the only real flaw being they ran out of mushrooms. A good option if you don't want to wait in Epic lines at mamas.
author: Ash S.

description: We came here based off of recommendations while visiting San Fran for the weekend. The homemade hollandaise sauce on the eggs Benedict was amazing. My husband for the corned beef hash and it was just as good. The advice was fast and it was really convenient to get to. Highly recommend.
author: Kimberly K.

description:
This place was a great find! Got me through gradschool, on a budget and filled my belly with joy. I'm sure my gradschool friends would say the same.

Chef came out to greet us almost every time to see if everything was cooked well. Good wine/food pairings and just felt very comfy and warm like being at home.
author: Nahush G.

description: I was in town for Fleet Week and was told about this place by a local Fireman who recommend I try it. Hands down one of the best Cafes I have been to! I loved the food, atmosphere, and quality in service. Great place!!
author: Garrett M.

description: The food is pricey, but the portion size makes up for it.  Service was excellent, and the food was even better.  Highly recommend visiting this place
author: Shay A.

description:
the insides needs to be a little more cleaner...

but food is decent , love the fresh jalepenos but needs a bit more flavor :)
author: Ruby P.

description: My family and I arrived in San Francisco after a crazy impulse...we had no plans or specific destination but found Pat's Cafe and it didn't dissapoint. Waitress was nice and attentive. I gave it 4 stars because of the price of my crepe...other than that it was a good place.
author: Jo N.

description: Great staff and better food. Got to try this place.   Pat was there greeting customers and making sure things were running smoothly. Excellent food.
author: Jean C.

description: Great place for breakfast.  Coffee is really good, I am a big fan of diner coffee back east, so this is a plus.  Try the San Francisco omelet, service is very friendly and provides timely service.  Little traffic on street, great place to relax.
author: Gregory L.

description: Food was great- we got the french toast special and banana granola pancakes. The french toast was some of the best we've had! So light and fluffy. Service was pretty slow for a quick breakfast spot.
author: Julia G.

description:
What a great restaurant nestled in the a quiet neighborhood off of a busy SF street. Definitely LOVE the mom and pop feel as soon as you walk in. Its little cafes and places like this that make SF so awesome.

My brother, fiancé and myself stopped in for breakfast after a fun weekend. Service was great, he went over the different specials and was very thorough to make sure all of our questions about the menu were met. 

After ordering 3 dishes, our food was out within minutes-that was nice! I ordered the chicken and mushroom crepe which came with a side of fruit. The crepe was delicious and cooked to perfection. It was stuffed enough with yummy chicken, basil, cheese and veggies-needless to say I was stuffed after eating half of it.
The proportions are very reasonable, meaning pretty hefty which also means you definitely get your moneys worth here. 

I personally LOVED the homemade pico de galo salsa- on of the best I have ever tasted!
author: Lene N.

description: Nice breakfast, quiet during the weekdays, worth the visit.  I had the house made corned beef hash, 2 eggs over medium and house made biscuits with a peppery sausage white gravy, and of course sourdough toast with strawberry jam.  Yummy
author: Anthony S.

description: Oh happy day!!! So glad we found this place. Great location and kind servers. But what made it fabulous? The food. I literally wanted to lick my plate. No joke. The side potatoes were amazing. Ordered the eggs Benedict and THAT SAUCE though!!! I couldn't quite place the flavor, but it was a bit of heaven. Their hollandaise was to die for.  I could drink it. Hubs got the California crepe. We are going back tomorrow as we are so impressed! You will leave happy!
author: Candice D.

description: DO NOT EAT HERE IF YOU ARE NOT WHITE!! We placed our name on the list and waited with our two toddlers for 30 minutes to be seated. We watched several couples who arrived after us seated while we continued to wait. The final straw came when a group of 6 white men and women who arrived after our party were seated before us. We asked why they were seated before us. We were told that they were waiting longer. My husband called them out on their lie and told them to look at the list. The list clearly showed that we had arrived five minutes before the other party. They did not have an answer so they just looked at us!!!
author: Mavel G.

description: I loveeeedddd everything here . What an amazing taste . Egg hater like me who needs to egg due to medical reason loved the egg
author: Priyanka D.

description: Service was good! Workers were very helpful and kind. Their specialty coffees were delicious if you're a coffee lover. However, the food wasn't very hot when we got it and it did take a while to get to us. Also, kind of expensive but lots of good healthy options.
author: Celia L.

description:
Great service, average breakfast food. Nothing innovative or to die for.
Looks like the owner is a photographer and likes to sell his framed photos. I found a little unsettling how many cats he owns and photographs... For me, who don't like those animals, it felt like the whole kitchen was full of cat fur...I don't have evidence or anything to substantiate that claim... It's just empirical from what I felt, surrounded by cats in a worm down dining room that is.... Wait for it... Carpeted... Yikes.
author: Alejandro L.

description:
Hungry and not willing to wait in the line of 40 people at Hollywood Cafe, I took the stroll a couple block's over to Pat's Cafe. 

The wait time here was about 7 minutes- completely bearable.  We weren't helped by any of the staff to put our name in, in fact we were directed by others who were waiting in line.  

Once we were seated, we got our drinks and put our order in pretty quickly, but the wait time from there was dreadful.  

Finally, the food arrived - a California omelet for my boyfriend and French Toast for me.  We were both really pleased with our choices. The french toast was very thick and the bread quality was better than most I've had.  The potatoes that came with my boyfriends omelet were seasoned perfectly and VERY good. 

With the food tasting good and the prices being completely fair - especially considering the city we were in, this place deserves four stars.

I would have taken pictures but by the time my food came I was so hungry I forgot to take a photo!
author: Liz O.

description:
Hi foodies...

I've been going here for four years now. The service and food is amazing. I'm never short of food here. The service is quick and the expectations are real. The lady owner will always be there with her trusted staff in their black t-shirts. You can't go wrong with this place and it is situated in lovely sunny part of San Francisco. Just off the tourist part of fisherman's wharf and on the corner of Starbucks. 

YOU WILL NOT REGRET GOING HERE. 

Regards  
Damien
author: Damien Ó.

description: Great steak and eggs. Recommended ordering to go because the place is busy and the servers have more attitude than necessary.
author: Mona A.

description: This is the best diner style cafe in North Beach. The menu covers all the basic brunch necessities. The breakfast burrito is my favorite but the coffee is great and the service is even better. My friends have gotten different omelets and they have been happy with each and every one!
author: Taylor P.

description:
They serve breakfast until 2pm everyday and boy was I happy about that.  I was staying with a friend at the Holiday Inn Express nearby, when we woke up a little later than planned but still wanted breakfast.  We walked on over to Pat's cafe and our meal hit the spot!

I got the biscuits and gravy with two scrambled eggs (I had them add cheese to the eggs and they did not skimp!)  It was a hearty portion and I was stuffed!  The gravy was nice and thick with plenty of sausage bits.  Yum!  

Definitely recommend for breakfast. 

Oh and the decor is fun and colorful. And who doesn't love a place with photographs of cats on the wall?!
author: Elyse M.

description: This was a great breakfast! I had the veggie omlet and it was fabulous! Lots of veggies and feta. So good!
author: Maegen A.

description: Ate here twice while in San Francisco twice twice last week and enjoyed breakfast very much! It was about 2 blocks from our hotel which was very handy. The people were friendly, helpful and accommodating. The food was delicious and portions large enough to share (which we did!)
author: Elizabeth C.

description: We came here for a local breakfast while staying nearby. We came both days and absolutely loved it! The biscuits and gravy are very southern and were our favorites! Best we've had on the west coast! Would love to visit again. Our server was very friendly and served us both days. Great experience!
author: Crystal R.

description: Had breakfast burrito with ham. One of the best I've had. Used black beans instead of potatoes. Great change. Also had a little jalapeño yum. Could only finish half (ok, could have wanted it all and wanted too but I would have regretted it the rest of the day). That way I got to enjoy it the next morning. And just as good. Dad had the crepe. Good. Actually really good but mine was the winner.
author: Paul G.

description: Spent $16 on a crab omelet. Tiny in size and tasted more of the crunchy, barely cooked chopped peppers than anything else.
author: Buddy L.

description: How can you get wrong with the order when there is one person in the hotel.  I ordered a crepe, after eternity I get an omelette.  My friend orders a bagel and he gets a bacon.  Horrible place - avoid at any cost
author: Vignesh I.

description: Pats is like a hidden gem near all the craziness of Fishermans Wharf.  All the other places to eat breakfast have a long line and a significant wait but with a very short 2 block walk inland from the wharf is the nicest small comfortable spot with a great selection and good food.  Once we found it we ate there every morning.  Good coffee and a great variety on the menu.  The crepes weren't my favorite but they have some great corned beef hash, pancakes, French toast  and eggs and what appears to be homemade orange juice.  I would highly recommend that anyone make the quick walk from the wharf to Pats and sit right down and enjoy a nice breakfast.
author: Rick G.

description: Love having this place in the neighborhood - recommended for a delicious breakfast with friendly staff
author: Matt V.

description: Good food and service, cofortable atmosphere and people that know how to run a restaurant!
author: David H.

description: Tuesday lunch. Ordered chicken tacos. They arrived cold with ice cold pineapple salsa. Served with french fries so encrusted with salt that they were inedible. Inattentive service. My third and last visit to this vastly overrated establishment.
author: Jeff E.

description:
A slice of home spun country in the heart of the city! SF's little secret you want to tell everyone about. 

French toast is thick and tastes amazing! CA omelet was savory. 
 
2nd time here. Will DEFINITELY come again!
author: Mark B.

description: LOVE THIS CAFE! Such an adorable place and is in an excellent location- right next to the cable car stop in Fishermans! Staff is very friendly and the owner is such a sweet lady! If you like a sweet breakfast, I recommend the "Go Wild" with the French toast! We were seated quickly and the food came out fast! Love it! Great place to beat the craziness and crowded wait times for Cafes in union square!
author: Emily O.

description: This place is fantastic. The hollandaise sauce was the best I've ever had, the pancakes were incredible, the bacon was perfectly crisp, and the crab cake was delicious. Highly recommend this place.
author: David M.

description:
Now this was a gem of a find during my stay in San Francisco!

My family wanted to eat breakfast near the hotel before going on the Alcatraz tour and Patz Cafe was in close proximity. If you're close to Fisherman's Wharf, have breakfast here.

Thank goodness it was close because their biscuits & sausage gravy was served hot and fresh and was delicious. I finished the whole plate quickly. The home fries too were yummy. The omelette my mom had was full of flavor and filling. See the trend here?

There are no frills in the food when it comes to this colorful and cozy breakfast spot in the North Beach area. It serves a simple and yummy array of breakfast and brunch item so hit it up if you want that.
author: Raymart D.

description: Terrible! Service felt rushed, and the owner was just waiting around for people to take their last bite of food before shoving the check in their faces- I understand the need to turn tables especially during peak times but come on! Servers were polite and trying their best to keep up. Once the food arrived-PLAIN OL' EGGS- $10.99, I asked for a spoon in order to serve salsa on my plate- only knives on a napkin- on the table at the time we were seated. The owner tosses the spoon ON THE TABLE even though I had my hand out to receive it from her. Wouldn't go back, overpriced and the food is nothing special. The lady that owns this place is something else!!
author: AL H.

description: Excellent breakfast spot. At the recommendation of many yelp reviews I got the salmon scramble, which was as good as advertised. My sister got the banana granola pancakes and if I could go back in time knowing what I know now that probably would've been my pick. Our server was very friendly and struck the perfect balance between being overbearing and ignoring us. This is a truly a fine art and I am impressed. The coffee was a plus as well. 10 out of 10, would eat again.
author: Nick L.

description:
This is as smooth of a breakfast operation as you can get. Service is on point, atmosphere is cozy and inviting without being overdone and the menu leaves you stumped as to what you should even order! There are so many great options!! I have been here over 50+ times and swear by it. 

I have not had a dish here that I did not like, but if there is one thing you must have it is the french toast with fruit (breakfast) or the spinach special (lunch). In regards to the spinach special, if cheese is not your thing, try to have the monterey jack substituted for feta. 

Service is quick and efficient and your food will arrive promptly, but do not feel rushed. They are happy to have you sit and sip your coffee. 

If you are in San Francisco, this place is a must! It's a genuine cafe with good food and good service. Also a great recommendation if you want to remove yourself from the pretentious brunch scene in San Francisco and still have an excellent meal.
author: Mark H.

description: Nice little stop and colorful indeed. Everyone super friendly, no rush, cool atmosphere and interesting menu. Stopped for a espresso, will be back for a snack.
author: Nick S.

description: Great food, service and atmosphere!!!We were looking for a good place to eat with kids on our way to Alcatraz and had less than an hour to get to our destination. We saw the cute sign  for Pat's Cafe and decided to go there. We were not disappointed. The food was delicious!!!!The atmosphere delightful. And the service was fast and friendly!! Pat was so sweet she and Franciso even helped us print out a document we needed for our trip that we'd forgotten to print before arriving in San Franciso. The kids kept asking the rest of the trip can we go back to Pat's for breakfast. Don't get caught up in the tourist trap fast food joints. Check out Pat's for an authentic San Francisco food experience. Great lattes too!
author: Davina K.

description: I went to Pat's on 4/2/16 and really enjoyed the food. The service was good, the only thing I will say is I noticed a glass was not as clean as I would of preferred, but when I said something they quickly made a new drink with a clean glass. I ordered  the half of Belgian waffle with Bacon and fruit, and my friend had the salmon eggs Benedict. I enjoyed every bite, I will be going back again.
author: Love G.

description: Great, attentive service. Decent food, not too busy on a weekday morning. Would come again!
author: Angela P.

description: We keep coming back to Pat's on every visit to SF for the awesome food, service and ambiance. Highly recommend their breakfast menu!
author: Joey Z.

description: came here because of the good ratings. The service was alright, they don't offer substitutions on a very baisically menu, which isn't bad but when we got our food they made a mistake on it and everything tasted bland. Regret not just going to ihop down the street.
author: Angela C.

description: Nice, quaint little cafe. Close to our hotel. Good selection of foods. Got our order wrong and was a little slow, but overall, good experience.
author: Lin D.

description: First time here and was extremely satisfied. Breakfast was Delish.  If your in the neighborhood I highly recommend coming here. Any breakfast choice you make will be excellent!
author: Kristy C.

description: Got the banana oatmeal pancake gone wild per usual. Super rich but delicious. The girlfriend got the salmon Benedict with cold avocado and arugula. Nice and quant spot!
author: Charles H.

description: Went for brunch in Saturday - was happy to find it was not crowded. Unfortunately our food arrived cold. Eggs that the were ordered over-medium came with runny whites. Bacon was only two strips - would have liked more. Home fries were very good though, and warm. Coffee also tasty. Belgium waffle lacked any crunchiness, pretty plain. Also we had three waiters ask for our order before we were ready, then the check was hard to track down - rushed and then ignored. To top it off my drinking glass was dirty. Over all a very meh experience.
author: Rita C.

description: I have been a long time north beach resident and have eaten at all the breakfast spots in this neighborhood, Pats used to be on my regular rotation until the food started going down hill rapidly. I went there today because I was running errands and got really hungry and didn't want to wait inline at my favorite spot, and its been a few yr since the last time I was here I thought I would give it another try...well it was a bad idea. My omelette was watery and tasteless, the potatoes were overly spiced and on top of that they charged me for switching a different type of cheese...it was the most disappointing $20 breakfast I've spent in a long time, Pat seems like a nice lady but her food....not so much. Go to Hollywood cafe a few blocks toward the wharf, yes they always have a line but the food is so wroth the wait!!!
author: Ladywolf M.

description: I love Pat's! The food is great, the service is great and the prices are great. They have so many different unique and delicious options on their breakfast menu! There are many different flavors of pancakes. I got pecan pumpkin pancakes, and they were delicious! You can choose how many pancakes you want: 1, 2 or 3. I got one but I would recommend getting 2 because it is a lot more satisfying. You can also add Nutella to almost anything! The only downside is that there are no free refills. Overall, Pat's is a great place to eat and if you are a tourist or a local searching for somewhere to get breakfast, go to Pat's!
author: Priscilla L.

description:
What's good here? We don't know, we never got served! We sat an hour and never got served. So much for good food.

UPDATE: The owner was very nice and sent me a message on yelp
author: Marshy M.

description: Perfect for what we wanted-quick breakfast reasonably quickly before venturing out for the day at a reasonable price. We had breakfast burrito and California omelet. Burrito was excellent, omelet solid.
author: Sam M.

description:
Straight forward and to the point breakfast & lunch joint that gets the job done with palate pleasing food--graciously fresh vs. greasy and lard-laced like many other "cafe" type spots. Both the crab cake benedict and egg burrito were delish, the maple bacon on the latter especially. The potatoes were also perfectly potato poised. 

The service was teetering on the lackluster due to delayed/slow service until they spontaneously gave us some complementary apple chicken sausage that made me forget about my evaporating and empty water cup. They also had great, big smiles on the whole time and I'm a huge fan of that particular facial expression. 

Yah the prices aren't necessarily "cheap" but they're standard for the area, and if you're looking for something reliable and casual, I highly recommend it!! 

PATS= perfectly acceptable table selections. ;)
author: Brian K.

description:
Never experienced this at a breakfast place.  They have 5 or 6 different benedict dishes.  One of them is the classic and another is one with bacon and spinach.  I asked the server if I could have them add spinach to the classic figuring he would say OF COURSE.  Instead he said they do not allow substitutions.   It was a very simple request to add spinach to my egg benedict knowing that they add spinach to other meats in egg benedicts.  

It was not a cost issue.  He just said the kitchen will not do substitutes.  I have never encountered this before.  This is a breakfast place which should just be giving people eggs the way the customer wants them.  It is not a 5 star restaurant where you are messing with their recipes.  This was not my first visit to Pats.  I have been there maybe 10 times over the years.  However, because of how ridiculous the conversation was regarding ordering spinach to be added to a dish, it is also the very first restaurant that I have walked out of which is too bad as I am a local and once in a while I would like to go to a breakfast place to get breakfast that I want.
author: Ben S.

description: Oh my! Quite the delightful breakfast find. We are staying at a nearby hotel and had breakfast here two days in a row. We had the breakfast sandwich, french toast special & eggs benedict. All were amazing. Pat herself checked in on us & the staff was friendly. Highly recommend.
author: Anna F.

description:
The breakfast is simple but delicious. 
Service was attentive and quick.
I like the location because it's away from the touristy main streets, so you can actually be seated as soon as you walk in  
Prices are fair.
author: Letiza M.

description: My mother and I went in to have breakfast this morning, a waiter greeted us and sat us at the front table by the window. We ordered and were served our cappuccinos promptly. We waited and waited and waited and never received our orders. It was sort of busy so we were not pushy until it was almost 40 min and much of the restaurant cleared out. The waiter who took our order had disappeared. Another woman who had just walked in and sat at the bar received her order and that was it for us. The we told the nearest waiter what had happened and he said we can have the coffee on the house. Great wasted my morning-obviously we won't be going back.
author: tiff P.

description: Certified best breakfast in SF! Away from touristy places,cozy, warm and inviting. We had Joe's special eggs and it was amazing. Crepes with Nutella were delicious. Belgian waffles were soft and fresh. The paintings on the wall are of SF scenes and are up for sale. The service was friendly and fast. this place is a must discover , must stop spot in SF.  I will most definitely be back again .
author: Jay K.

description:
Review for 2/10/13
3.5 stars. The service and staff were very friendly. The food itself was good but nothing extraordinary. I has the Mediterranean omelet and my friend had the granola banana pancakes. Those were pretty tasty but we both agreed we had had better specialty pancakes. Overall a normal dining experience but noting extraordinary.
author: Miriam M.

description:
This is a gem in North Beach!

The service here was excellent, everyone is extremely friendly.

Food was bomb! I had eggs benedict and my bf had corned beef hash. The corned beef hash was one of the best around the city.

Saw someone else with french toast with strawberries and nutella, got really jealous, and ordered one for ourselves. Definitely worth feeling extremely full afterwards.
author: Angela L.

description: The food was nothing special. I ordered the egg white omelette with spinach and veggies. I probably could have made this dish at home. I would not come back.
author: Rosanna T.

description: Nice little spot we were quickly seated during the breakfast rush. Ordered corner hash with eggs over easy corned beef was cubed and a good portion eggs were perfectly over easy and sourdough toast. My wife had a ham egg and cheese croissant which was big enough she couldn't finish. One son had the Nutella crepes which he loved and my other son had pancakes which he couldn't finish one after insisting on getting 2. They also had a side of bacon which was nice thick cut bacon not some thin Oscar Meyer bacon. Coffee was good as well and the chocolate milk for the boys was good as it had real chocolate syrup and whole milk. Overall great breakfast nice portions and not overly greasy like some breakfast joints.
author: Nate C.

description:
I don't get to go to San Francisco as much as I would like, but when I do I do my best to seek out the most interesting restaurants I can.  The Bay Area being, in my opinion, San Diego and Orange County's toughest rival on the west coast as far as dining is concerned, I do so with great relish, and Yelp is my guide.  Rolling out bed early on a Saturday morning, hoping to find someplace close by that was original and masterful, the Yelp app guided me from my bedchamber to this place just off of the Cable Car line.

Pat's is a hole-in-the-wall, its bright, colorful marquee rendering an otherwise hidden sliver of a restaurant more visible.  At 8:00 AM on a Saturday, the restaurant sat mostly empty, with a few back tables occupied by local couples.  Shortly after I was seated, however, people began filtering in, and within fifteen minutes the room was filled and there was a line.  Though at first apprehensive about my choice, I decided that San Franciscans sleep in, and that the crowd would validate the wisdom of my fellow Yelper's opinions.

After taking in the assorted artwork (all for sale) depicting variously ironic interpretations of the Golden Gate coast and its landmark suspension bridge, the time came to look over the menu.  The variety is sufficiently wide so as to appeal to anyone: eggs any style, assorted specialty benedicts including California style (replacing ham with an heirloom tomato and adding avocado), and all manner of delicious (and deliciously sinful sounding) griddle classics... peanut butter chocolate chip pancakes?  That sounds perfect.

In fact, it's exactly what I went for, along with an apple chicken sausage and a poached egg.  I'll say it now:  the pancake is dessert and ONLY dessert.  I shiver to consider how much starch and sugar was in that thing, and how many days were shaved off my life with each bite, but lord it was worth it.  The pancake's texture was fluffy and subtly sweet, the chocolate melting like a striated braided stream throughout its heavenly interior.  The peanut butter, creamy and melted, added a rich nuttiness that perfectly complemented it, rendering syrup superfluous (as if that wasn't obvious.)  It was basically a peanut butter cookie in grander scale... and would keep my engine running all day long.  The chicken sausage was smokey and savory, and the egg, poached medium, just the perfect amount of loose yolk.  

Service throughout was attentive.  The proprietor herself (give you three guesses on her name) made the rounds and personally checked with each guest - a friendly "good morning" and "is there anything I can do to make your meal special?"  I've yet to experience that in LA.  Very refreshing.

By the time I left (which took about 30 minutes), the line was stretching out the door.  This place is breakfast nirvana.  All told, I should have probably gone for something a little less dessert-like (the various eggs benedicts looked AMAZING) to offer a more exhaustive opinion, but for the first time in a long while I have absolute faith in a restaurant arising from only a single visit.  And more faith in the power of Yelp than I ever had before.
author: Milan B.

description: Average omelettes and generally greasy american breakfast food. I felt fairly heavy after eating here and could barely finish. Its main selling point is its location on a quiet street with no line while the other morning grease spots in the hood have hour + waits.
author: John H.

description:
This place has an amazing breakfast menu! We actually stumbled on it after being turned away from a ridiculous like that Mama's had. This place happened to be closer to our hotel in Fisherman's Wharf as well. 

I ordered the Mexican Omelet and requested it as a scramble. The food was delish! VERY generous portions as well. If I had to order it again, I would lose the roasted potatoes they offer you as a side item and substitute it for something else. I also ordered the Pamosa, which was pomegranate juice and champagne.  It sounded really yummy and it sure did taste good too! 

I would definitely recommend coming by here for breakfast if your looking for a solid meal before a full sightseeing day ahead.
author: Sonal P.

description: Went for Father's Day and amazingly had no wait. Busy but I guess we timed it right. Everything was delicious - even homemade hollandaise sauce. Great menu. Great service. Very good food. Recommend but hopefully won't make the line too long next time.
author: Judy H.

description: Ordered the veggie omelette to be on the lighter side. It was huge! All the veggies were fresh and I substituted the potatoes for the fruit, and there was no melon! That has to be. First!
author: brennan m.

description:
Headed over to Pats for a late breakfast after seeing the 4 star reviews. Food and service was ok. Nothing special. Portions were on the smaller, especially for the cost. It'd be great for a quick, small, affordable meal but that wasn't the case. 

I received a 20% off coupon through Yelp and I was extremely disappointed when they did not honor it. The server said they no longer do it although there was no expiration listed. I didn't see the coupon until after I had sat down (was reading Yelp reviews for what to order, and ended up finding more bad reviews in recent time than good) so the coupon was currently being promoted. 

Overall I don't think we'll be heading back to Pats. There are other options locally which are much better.
author: JJ L.

description: I really want to like this place more! It's super cute, never too busy, and has a really full menu of items that sound so delectable... But it always falls short. Tried it again this morning. Was seated up on arrival, but waited almost 10 minutes until they even gave me a menu. The same thing happened to the table that was seated next to us. Food took forever, but it tasted OK. Chorizo breakfast burrito was better then the item I had last time. A few weeks ago, I tried the San Francisco Omelette and it had to be the worst breakfast I've ever had. They placed scrambled eggs on top of wet, soggy spinach. And service was again slow. No one seems to be happy to work here. I recommend going somewhere else if you're in North Beach for brunch.
author: Meredith A.

description:
We received great service and good food. I highly recommend Darren's for breakfast.  
Irene from Miami.
author: Irene R.

description: Friendly staff, delicious food, and very nice ambiance.  I had the breakfast burrito with chorizo and a mimosa.  The service was good and the food came out perfect.  Thank you!
author: Jessica S.

description: Quaint, great music to accompany the delicious food and coffee. Great spot! Bfast burrito = yummy!
author: Lori B.

description: This is the best brunch and lunch spot in North Beach and nearby environs. The food is great and the service is even better. Pat often has big band music on the speakers and local art on the walls that make for a comfortable and relaxing atmosphere. The prices are reasonable as well. My favorite is the Mexican omelette, but I've sampled other dishes as well and have never been disappointed. Highly recommend.
author: local c.

description: Lots of menu selection, reasonably priced.  Food was tasty and service was friendly!  Great place for breakfast!
author: Steven L.

description: I've been to Pat's so many times that I've lost count... and each and every visit has been solid. The service is friendly and efficient, and Pat herself (the owner) is very sweet. I've ordered and enjoyed a variety of items on the breakfast menu and never had a bad meal. Overall, this is a solid place to get a good, well-priced, tasty breakfast in North Beach!
author: Ali M.

description: Pat's Cafe caters! The sliders we had were a huge hit! Thanks Pat!
author: Alex K.

description: Very good breakfast spot. Good variety of food and tastes like a homemade meal. Definitely check out this spot if you are in the area.
author: Allen M.

description: We stopped by Pat's for a late breakfast. It was Thursday so they had their weekend brunch menu available.  I had the Blackstone eggs Benedict, and my son had the crab omelet.  They were both fantastic. The eggs Benedict had bacon and spinach and a great Hollandaise sauce, the crab omelet was packed with crab.  Pat herself seated us.  This is now our go to breakfast place for our annual pub crawl in San Francisco.
author: Tim B.

description:
Palm trees out the window, cable cars stationed out front, a sunny window seat, piping hot coffee... what more could an SF cafe possibly offer?

Aside from free wifi and an outlet? (check!)

Pat's Cafe is tucked away on Taylor Street, a place you'd probably never go to unless a) you're a cable car junkie, or b) you happen to live in the 'hood. What a great find! Pat herself is friendly and accommodating, as is Francisco, who meets and greets and even re-heats coffee if needs be. The cafe itself is charming, the walls adorned with art and painted in orange and yellows. The menu boasts a wide variety of cozy breakfast foods ("plain 'ol eggs" with bacon, ham or sausage, crepes, Pecan Pumpkin Spice Pancakes!), and salads and wraps for lunch, with a "Something Else? Just Ask for It!" policy. 

They close from 2:30-5, but open again for dinner. Apparently Pat's is hopping on the weekends, when she offers an amazing brunch.

I think I just might start coming here every day, so feel free to come find me typing away in the window seat :)
author: Ray J.

description: What a delicious discovery!  I had the salmon scramble and delighted at every bite and the potatoes were so good no sauce was needed. The service was great and the food came out quickly. The inside is cute with lots of fun art on the wall to browse through.
author: Desiree L.

description:
Pat's is what it is, and it isn't what you think it is. That is to say, locals eat here. As much as the signs out on Columbus are designed to attract tourists (I don't blame them), Pat's is really a solid local not-quite-so-greasy spoon.

The prices are more than reasonable for what you get, and I've never had an order of eggs over medium (the trickiest of all diner eggs) prepared over or under-done there. They also make great omelets, and a solid selection of various takes on a Benedict.

I haven't spent much time on their lunch menu, because they close quite early (2:30pm), and tend to turn their sign over to close right on the dot, so as to avoid a herd of tourists walking in at the last moment. I'm also not a huge fan of their home-fries, which are flavorful but a little dry (more grease please!), and the flavor is almost sweet at times, which is just weird.

There are nice seats inside and out, and the service is almost always very quick unless it gets super busy. It's nice to live close to something easy and not-too-pricey, but I'll probably head over to Polk St. if I want a fancier brunch experience, and Van Ness for a greasier spoon.
author: Amy P.

description: Pricey but a lot better in terms of waiting time. You just walk in and breakfast is great. Beats waiting for Mamas.
author: Kevin L.

description: Cute little place. We originally waited in line at Mama's but fount this place instead with No wait time. The food was great, loved the French toast and pancakes. Very reasonably priced food and friendly staff
author: Lance R.

description:
Yum!

Got the California Crepes and the Blueberry Pancakes for breakfast this morning. The crepe was deeeeelicious and the homefries were just perfect. The actual pancakes were very good and fluffy, but my mom was expecting the blueberries to actually be cooked in the pancakes but they were just tossed on top.

Only downside was that the "real maple syrup" was an extra $1.75. Coming from the east coast, that should just be the real syrup offered!

I loved the big Pat's Cafe cup of tea that I received. Much nicer than the tiny cups you sometimes get at other places.

The window seat was lovely and the atmosphere was very relaxing. I loved that there was an outlet strip right by the seat just in case.. very thoughtful!

Update: Banana granola pancakes are amazing!! Fluffy with a nice granola chew! Get them wild style with nutella and strawberries... to die for.
author: Amanda N.

description: Crab balls to die for. Good people good food. Good service.  You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Must stop and eat here. Trust me
author: Drew O.

description: Not a very fancy place but the food is delicious and the waiters are super friendly!!! Highly recommended!!
author: Andreas A.

description: Our first trip to Pat's definitely won't be our last. We were staying at the Columbus Inn and wanted a nearby spot for breakfast. Tuesday morning, 9:00, no wait and our pick of seats. Waitstaff was friendly, efficient, and attentive. Food was fantastic. I had fruit crepes with seasonal fruit. My daughter ordered chocolate chip pancakes but they were out of chocolate chips, only negative of the visit. Husband ordered 3 pancakes, huge but delicious. Would highly recommend.
author: Terri D.

description:
I love to support small businesses, but the business must be worthy of support.  Sadly, I don't think this the case in Pat's Café.

Several years ago we stayed at the Columbus Motor Inn which is just around the corner from Pat's.  It was during the Christmas holiday and my wife and I enjoyed a very nice breakfast with tremendous service from an older lady who I assumed was the owner.

This morning hoping for a repeat of our original experience we again arrived at Pat's about 8:30 a.m.  The place was not busy, probably 5 tables were taken.  The sole waitress told us to sit anywhere which we did.  A few minutes later she brought over our menus and before asking us if we wanted coffee she departed the table.

A professional wait person should ask the customer in the morning if they want coffee even before presenting the menu.  This waitress was evidently not even close to professional.

She came back to the table in about 5 minutes and asked what we wanted.  I told her that we would like coffee first right after we ordered.  She then went to the front of the place and poured coffee refills for one table.  Then she gave the bill to another table and went up to the register and fiddled around with another bill.  She did not put our order in or bother to bring over our coffee.

After another few minute my wife and I agreed to get the hell out of there.  We passed by her and told her to cancel the order which she hadn't even placed with the kitchen.

We waked down to the Hollywood a few blocks north and had a nice breakfast and excellent service.

Note to Owner (Pat?)  Your wait staff can ruin your business no matter how great your food is.  Either supervise your staff and properly train them before you let them fly solo.
author: Bradley C.

description:
My friends and I used to come here often over the years but in the last year the food and the service has gone downhill. This morning we were seated immediately but waited over 15 min to get water/coffee brought to the table- after hitting the 30 min mark of being here we finally ordered. And then proceeded to wait another 30 min for the food to come out (we are only a party of 3 this morning, nothing crazy). 

Annnnnd the food was just bad. I had to ask for a steak knife to cut my French toast- never again.
author: Jill S.

description: The home fries are AWESOME!!! Strawberry jam and homemade maple syrup are both delicious. No complaints on anything- everything was great!
author: Erin K.

description: Got in fast with a group of 5 for a great hang over meal. Omelette were delicious, for sure a home run!
author: Mike M.

description:
Delicious coffees and Benedict brunch. I was recommended this place by a friend and finally got to go before the symphony concert at the pier. 

Best of all, there was no wait on a Saturday morning at 11am.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
How does this place have all these amazing reviews? My breakfast at Pat's was easily the low point of my entire trip to San Francisco. Yelp rarely has false negatives, but sometimes it does have false positives, and this was definitely one of those times.

First, in a town with this many options, the menu was singularly uninteresting. Pat's serves ordinary, run-of-the-mill American diner breakfast food. There's no exotic one-of-a-kind vegan options or local fruit sources or house-made granola or coffee from a SF roaster--none of that. So if you're looking for the familiar, this is the place; if you want more of the local flavor, stay away. Apart from the bright paint on the outside, the panache of this place is decidedly average.

Then there's the prices. Yes, Pat's is located on the edge of the touristy waterfront area. Yes, it's near several motels. But there are no deals to be found here. Take what you think mediocre American diner food should cost, double it, and you'll have Pat's pricing structure. If the food had tasted better, I would have been willing to pay even more--but it didn't, and I felt gouged for a very mediocre product.

Which brings me to the food... I paid $11 for the worst eggs benedict of my life. There was a single, thin strip of ham stretched across both halves of the english muffin, and the whole thing was simply drowned in melted butter. Yes, Hollandaise is supposed to contain butter, but melted butter was the only flavor, and it completely overwhelmed everything else. The cup of coffee was only OK and cost more than Starbucks.

Finally, service was slow, despite having several staff present doing very little.

In summary, at Pat's you overpay to be underwhelmed. This was the only restaurant I've regretted eating at in San Francisco, and I felt the 4-star Yelp rating had betrayed me. Steer clear.
author: David C.

description:
Great neighborhood; mediocre breakfast.

Pat's Cafe can be easily missed. You can't drive here (sorta) because it's at the Cable Car's dead end stop and if turned the blind eye, this cafe blends in quite well with the rest of the block. However, inside Pat's miniature doorway, you have a largely colorful but quiet restaurant with tons of seating and paintings done from our local San Franciscans. 

California Omelette - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=NQWOS8PdtCmkkbWeIE8qOg&userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ
Anything served with the word "California" in it means it must have avocado, and their California Omelette sure had avocado in it! However, the omelet itself was simply bland on it's own. The chopped chicken apple sausage tasted like regular sausages, the avocado was fresh but it wasn't well spread throughout the omelet, and there was just too much extra onions.. It came with house potatoes and pre-buttered toast of your choice but overall, it wasn't too much to rave about.

French Toast Special - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=kDpt3-d3IHG4CFbtmKdFPA&userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ
Possibly the most boring-looking breakfast plate I have ever seen (see picture). Two pork sausages, one egg of your choice, and two "sourdough bread" french toasts. Sourdough french toast? It was alright, up until you bit into the crumb of it. The center of the sourdough wasn't dipped with the french toast batter and the end result: it was just like eating only the inner portion of some plain sourdough. The house-made maple syrup was delicious but this should have be called the French Toast Sourdough, not Special.

A nice hidden little cafe in front of the Cable Car stop, with friendly service and moderate prices (a cup of coffee is $2.25. yikes!), but not the best breakfast I've had. There's also two tables for outdoor seating (which is how I found this place), but I would only come back for seconds if my nearby favorites were closed for the day. 

Nifty check-in offer: 20% off your dinner.
author: Albert L.

description: Very good little cafe. Make sure to sign in since they are a small place. Took a little bit to order, not too bad but it was worth the wait. My Crassanwich was good I had them add some veggies they were sautéed just the way I like them. My friends food was just as good, his eggs on his Benedict were cooked perfectly! The yolk was runny, everything on it was really good.
author: Mon-Cheri H.

description:
No, no, no, I can't go back there. I ordered bacon and eggs and belgian waffle.
Not a lot of plate. There was way too much plate and not nearly enough breakfast.
I paid a decent price for what I hoped was going to be a satisfying breakfast. 
I was seated right away and my order taken. The service is good the ambiance nice.
But there wasn't enough food to cover the plate. I'm sorry, but half a belgian waffle.
Who gets the other half when the waffle iron make a whole waffle? How long does the other half sit there until some orders another half of waffle. 
For that price I'll surely wait in line at The Cheesecake Factory. I won't leave hungry.
author: Brett W.

description: Had breakfast here on February 24, 2015. My wife had the California omelet (spinach, feta cheese) and I had the breakfast burrito. Portions were big  and the food was tasty. Coffee was ok. Service was good.
author: Stephen M.

description: We got mimosa's and breakfast. The servers were very friendly, and we were seated and served quickly. My husband got the French toast special (French toast, sausage and eggs) and I got the pancake special (pancakes, egg and bacon). It was more than enough food! We sat right by the window and people watched while we ate. We would definitely come here again if we are ever in SF!
author: Emily R.

description: Ordered grilled bugata cheese on rye with a side salad. Came out with white chese on white bread with fries and took 30 minutes. Also ordered fruit crepe with whip creme. Came out with nutella. Slow service, and not amazing food.
author: Josh G.

description: Solid breakfast. Not amazing but good, had the Waffle special. Hubby had the pancake special.  Clean, friendly staff great spot to hit on the way to fishermans Wharf.
author: Jewelz C.

description: Visited San Francisco for a few days and my favorite place in all of San Fran was Pat's Cafe! My best friend and I returned day after day for their breakfast burritos, coffee, and cozy atmosphere. On our last day we stopped in for our last burritos before returning to NYC and bought coffee mugs to remember our great experience.
author: Daisy C.

description: We are locals and have given Pat's a last go around. The two stars are directed to the service. They have probably the worst breakfast service in the city. We are never very sure who exactly our sever is and we always have to ask for more coffee or water; otherwise, they drop off the food and don't come back. Bummer.
author: Blythe B.

description:
Ate here for brunch recently, and it was decent. 

The biscuits and gravy and granola pancakes were pretty tasty, but the hanger steak and eggs were ordered seemed bland and the steak was chewy (and we ordered it medium rare). I'm pretty sure the steak wasn't even seasoned at all, actually. 

There was a little bit of a wait, but a 20 minute wait for brunch is not bad at all for San Francisco! Prices are a smidge on the high side but again - this is SF (and a touristy part of SF) Will probably try it again sometime and just try something else on the menu.
author: Yishian Y.

description:
tastes and feels like cheap cafeteria food. 

ordered the el ranchero with the server and LITERALLY 30 seconds later, the waiter served me the dish and it definitely wasn't hot or fresh. funny thing was the waiter exclaiming "LOOK HOW FAST THE FOOD CAME!" as if this was the selling point for me to come back.

eggs and beans look and tasted like they've been sitting around the kitchen for hours. service is strange.

hollywood cafe down the road is much much better and worth the wait.

don't settle for this tourist swill
author: Hoshun L.

description:
I should have known better than to order Mexican food in San Francisco that was out of the mission district. 

I had the Chilaquiles, so i thought, which turned out to be an omelette with tortilla chips on the bottom. Maybe some where out there in some region of Mexico or the southwest this is how it is made just maybe, but for sure this was the first time i have ever had it this way. I was really hoping for some chile sauce at least, but it failed to do that. So i was disappointed, especially wanting something with at least some spice to it, but if I wanted an omelette that day the food was great. 

The scenery was nice and so was the set up. It was a perfect breakfast spot and if I am ever int he mood for a good breakfast, not Mexican breakfast, I am sure to put this on the list to try and know the food is worth it, unless it is a failed attempt to provide mexican food. 

Therefore, I have to give this place two stars SOLEY for what I thought was a false advertisement of Chilaquiles. Sorry pat, maybe you will think of relabeling the name of the dish from "Chilaquiles" to "An omelette with a side of tortilla chips and potatoes"
author: Christopher S.

description: Not friendly, had to ask for my toast and drink refills.  Too bad I was really hoping to like it. My little one barely touched her food and no kids meals.
author: Ivonne L.

description: If your going for breakfast . Go somewhere else . Got the Belgian waffle special . Half of a waffle ( really) ? One cold egg and crappy bacon for 15 bucks. Joke !!
author: Jeff J.

description: Been here two mornings in a row and will for sure do the third. The coffee is great and so was the service. Had the banana granola pancakes and they were amazing. They offer real maple syrup which was great. Also had a fruit bowl. Prices are fair. Would highly recommend you give it a try.
author: James P.

description: Pats Hash. Homemade and good. Friendly folks and good view of passing trolleys.Also recommend the French toast special. Spongy lite sweetness made with ciabatta bread...unique!
author: Kevin B.

description: I give this place 2 stars. Both my husband and I ordered the waffle combo with scrambled eggs and bacon. I got mine with the Nutella and strawberries. I thought the half waffle was good. My plate came to about $14. A little on the high side for the portions. The eggs were cold. Bacon was good and crunchy but very small. I don't like scrambled eggs without salsa so I ordered a side of salsa $1 and what I got was pico de gallo. My cold eggs ended up on my husbands plate because he will eat anything. Staff was okay not too friendly but not rude. All in all I think you have better choices in the area for the price.
author: Jackie D.

description:
Pat is a sweet lady. I would know that because she took our order and helped us, even though we also had a waitress. It's nice to meet the owner of the restaurant and also have them personally serve you. This place has a great local feel, as it makes its own maple syrup and hash browns (both delicious!).

I had a mimosa and it put my group in a comfortable morning talking mood. For my entree I had the salmon eggs Benedict, which was delicious. It fixed by cravin' for an eggs Benedict real well mmm :)
author: Tim F.

description:
This place has good food for the price. Rarely a line to get in. Big fan of the portabello mushroom melt in a pita with a salad or cilantro fries. Had a crepe today which was amazing. 

Pat is usually at the restaurant and stops by to talk to each table to check in. I overheard her giving a gentleman tips on what to do in SF and she provided him with a map. Warm and friendly service at a cafe close to the cable car turn around on Mason and Bay. Tourists and locals alike come here to eat and local artwork adorns the walls.

I have never been disappointed here with my food. From breakfast to lunch, and now dinner, check out Pats for consistently good food fare.
author: Ami K.

description: Great Breakfast on a rainy day in San Francisco.!
author: Pat W.

description:
Amazing food!!! Hidden in North Beach near Fisherman's Wharf but not touristy. Best kept secret. 

They have great food and coffee. Plus the owner, Pat, is typically there which is great. 

The servers are friendly, attentive, and well versed in their menu items.
author: Bree W.

description: I had a chocolate chip pancake, which they said was small but it fills up your whole plate. Don't order two of you think they're the size of regular pancakes. My group mates had the California omelet and the breakfast burrito. They thought they were very good- "One of the best breakfast burritos ever". It was very quiet and nice. I would come back here.
author: Olivia S.

description: Took them about 30 minutes to seat 2 people when there were about 6 spots available. Then, after sitting, it took them about 20 minutes to get waters and coffees. When our waiter took our order, might as well have said "what do you want." And the food was nothing to write home about. Denny's will get you an overall better experience.
author: Adam A.

description:
OMG. When I saw a sign on the street claiming "Awesome Food" I could not resist. 

Happy to say I was pleased with both their Awesome Food and Wicked Staff!

Portions and prices were right, and it even warmed my heart to watch the staff care for an elderly gentleman who is quite the regular. I recommend this place to anyone in the area.
author: Heather D.

description: Seriously the BEST eggs Benedict I have ever had!! Homemade hollandaise sauce that was mouth watering!! Coffee tasted amazing and they even offered apple chicken sausage too. Over heard that their French toast was a house favorite! Next time I'm in the city I will be back for brunch!!
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Pat on the back.

Cranberry relish was rather amazing. Together with turkey on ciabatta and a side salad it was a lunch deserving of applause.

Bank account unfortunately does not share the enthusiasm. $16 for the above plus a mediocre Americano was steep. You do get WiFi. You don't get sugar free syrups.

However the best things in life are never free. And that relish is one of the best.
author: Jason B.

description: Small Cafe tucked away in the north Beach area(non-tourist spot so no long lines)  Food was pretty good. Service was very polite.  Felt like a warm, family-environment.  We had "Joe's Special" & Banana-granola pancakes.  Their biscuits are Very good. They have several different pancake flavors to choose from (ex. Bacon pancakes) I'd definitely come back here to eat!!
author: David H.

description: The best corned beef hash I've had and the potatoes were phenomenal! Great service and atmosphere. Service was good, didn't have to wait very long for food. Overall excellent experience. Highly recommended for anyone in the area.
author: Patrick F.

description:
Fabulous breakfast yet again. Fast service. Amazing eggs Benedict - best I've ever had: and ate too much of the banana nut pancakes. 

Pat is a joy and the staff is always friendly and smiling.
author: Matt A.

description:
If I could give no stars, I would. 

Our experience at Pat's was a no go from the beginning. It started when we ordered our drinks - coffee and a cappuccino. The coffee came out right away but we waited for over ten minutes before being able to get  the waitress' attention for the cappuccino. She acknowledged it hadn't come out yet, and brought it over about 2 minutes later. This cappuccino was AWFUL - why? Because the milk had gone sour. We flagged over the waitress and she was confused by our statements of the cappuccino being sour and honestly, disgusting, and my request for just a plain coffee.  

The creamer on the table was room temperature... I don't think it should be difficult to keep half and half in the fridge until your customers order coffee. 

The food was okay - nothing special. I was underwhelmed. We did not see the waitress again. 

A waitress, I can only assume it was "Pat," used our table for her extra hands while serving another table. She left some of her tools there after she was done serving and never returned to get them. 

We asked to get the check and waited over 10 minutes (again) only to be provided a bill with  the cappuccino on it. I asked the waitress, who I had to flag down again, to please remove it and she stared at me confused for several long seconds only to remember that the cappuccino had been bad and she had replaced it with a regular black coffee. The new bill came back multiple minutes later. 

So the long and the short of it, horrible service with really no redeeming qualities.
author: Denise T.

description: I came here for breakfast one morning and was greeted by a friendly face standing behind the counter. I got the breakfast burrito, it was good and it kept me full almost the entire day. I also tasted the eggs benedict and pancakes, which were good. The service here is really good as everyone is very nice.
author: Faith A.

description: Great food and great service. Good for kids and small groups. Walking distant form tourist area.
author: Abdulla V.

description: They have so many breakfast and brunch options that I literally got lost, definitely best place in a neighborhood!
author: Aléna N.

description: Had an amazing breakfast today. I ordered the banana granola pancake with a side order of fresh fruit. it was very good and very fresh.  The coffee was delicious. The staff was friendly and service was good.  There was a lot of local customers coming into the place so that tell me that they serve consisting good food.
author: Denise L.

description: We ended up at Pat's after being discouraged by the queue at mama's. We waited five minutes and we were able to choose from a wide range of eggs, French toasts, pancakes among others. The food came quickly and it was delicious, the staff was very nice and the bill pretty cheap (43 for 2ppl including tip). Would definitely go back!
author: Julien S.

description:
First and foremost: they do NOT currently serve real maple syrup!

I got crabcakes Benedict and a pancake on the side. The crab cakes were bland (though had plenty of crab and little filler) and their "specialty hollandaise" was essentially flavorless. Potatoes tasted good but were old and lukewarm. Pancake was gummy and heavy, and only Aunt Jemimah's syrup!

Service was nice but very lax. Had to ask for the pancake and they clearly forgot to make it as it took 5 more minutes to arrive. 

Do yourself a favor and stick out the wait for Mama's.
author: Michael W.

description:
To be fair, it might have just been the specific dish I had, but I wasn't a fan of this place. I ordered the "Joe's Special" which seemed appealing by description. When it came out, it was basically a mess of eggs and vegetables sitting in a small plate of water. It was probably from all the spinach, which seemed to make up half of the dish. The water really ruined the taste of the egg, and there wasn't a whole lot of meat at all to make up for the rest of the omelet. To make it worse, my bill came out to roughly $13 for this disappointing meal.

The service seems pretty great though, so I'll bump it up from the two stars I would've given for the food alone. I came in just before the lunch hour so there weren't many people in here yet. The waiter was able to serve me very quickly. There were a few people who came in and they seemed like regulars since all the staff seemed to know them. So I guess at least this place has that.
author: Allen C.

description: Never got to eat as their wait staff were extremely rude. Very unfortunate as they are right next to where live - lost a regular.
author: Kevin A.

description: Nothing fancy about this cute little place that seats only about 30 people. We had a table for 4 and got the egg burrito and the SF omelette and the Calif omelette and the hash. All were tasty and well prepared. The service was prompt and friendly. Prices reasonable, too. There are more elegant places for breakfast or brunch but you will enjoy this cozy setting and its good food.
author: Bill W.

description: Best biscuits and gravy - seriously, I was surprised how good they were. Also, they actually season the breakfast potatoes which were also really good. A great find in SF!!
author: Sharon G.

description:
Holy wait time Batman. I will say, it was during fleet week and Columbus day eve but come on man.

I even called ahead and they told me "we never have a long wait." To a degree that was true. They sat us after about 30 minutes. However, it took another hour to get our food -- this was after we ordered standing up to "expedite things."

The front host guy was rude. He later asked if he could do anything to make up for it. When we asked for a round of drinks on the house, as we had plowed through 3, waiting for some eggs, he simply laughed it off. FYI the bloody Mary's suck so don't let the $5 tag tempt you. Tasted like cocktail sauce instead of tomato. The mimosas were ok.

Pat came around later and she seems super nice. Maybe it was an off day, but it was enough to probably make me want to try another place for breaky n North Beach as a non local.

The food was 4* though. Must admit it was damn tasty. Breakfast for 4 runs about 100. We did not tip very well though with the service we got.

Other customers were also pissed off. The people next to us took an "upper decker" in their toilet because they waited so long. I'm not in third grade anymore, but I thought it was hilarious. Hopefully the rude guy had to clean it!!!
author: Bobby C.

description: Originally we were going to Mama's but the line was down the block. I was edging into hangry territory so we didn't want to wait. I'm so glad we found Pat's instead! I took previous reviewers' suggestions and got the banana granola pancakes. They were amazing!! The service was fast and there was no wait for a table. The perfect breakfast combination!
author: Lori M.

description:
Absolutely loved it here.
First of all, the music is great and creates a wonderful, relaxing atmosphere.
Staff is very welcoming and helpful.
Food was delicious, not too oily and had homemade taste in the best way possible;)
Cappuccino was great, loved the foam!

And cafe itself looks truly adorable!When again in San Francisco, will definitely come back!
author: Paulina M.

description:
It makes no sense to me that this place has an average of 4 stars on Yelp:

- food took almost one hour to get to us
- my coffee was NEVER refilled, even AFTER I asked for it
- no butter or maple syrup on table or coming with food, hard to ask because servers were not around
- food was MEDIOCRE to BAD. Soggy fries, no hash browns available, steak with weird texture.

There are much better places on Columbus Ave nearby.
author: Rodrigo B.

description:
Went to Pat's after seeing the line wrapped around Mama's. I got the granola banana pancakes with eggs and bacon. The food was pretty good. Nothing to write home about, but I'm not too picky. 

I'm giving it three stars because of the customer service. Not the worst I've ever had, but I didn't feel welcome. My waitress never came back to my table to check up, and only said three words to me. Actually three words: "ready?" and "you done?". All in all, it wasn't truly a bad experience, just a 3/5 one.
author: Michael S.

description: The chicken wrap was very good.  It was filled with rice, avocado, black beans and chicken.  The owner Pat is very attentive and pleasant.  If you are looking for a great home cooked food and atmosphere head to Pat's.
author: S D.

description: I live down the street and have been to Pats before and have been disappointed more than once. I was lazy to go anywhere else so I walked in at 1:00 pm on a Monday for a burger. There was not 1 person in the place but myself. The person working acted like it was his first day. He seemed to have no clue. I asked for a cheeseburger with mayo, pickles and lettuce. He dropped the food and the fries were hot and fresh and it had 2 pieces of romain and 2 pickle spears? When he took my order I knew he was confused. Then he left and never offered ketchup. When I was halfway finished someone else came by and offered ketchup. I never did see the other guy again. Worst service ever for being the only one in the restaurant. As for the burger, average to say the least. I really wish this place was good as it's the closed restaurant to where I live.
author: Leland L.

description: Great atmosphere and wonderful wait staff! They are all very attentive. Food was delicious and they didn't rush us. They also didn't charge for a second tea bag: most places do!! And free wifi!
author: Jaclyn M.

description:
Horrible service...way too slow!
We've been seated pretty quickly but to get the food was another story...we've had to waith most likely 40+ minutes...and they serve a greek salad with no olive nor olive oil WTF!!!
author: Olivier M.

description: Great little breakfast place. Near the jumping off point for several tourist adventures, without feeling like a tourist place.
author: John P.

description: This place was awesome. Did not have to wait too long on a Saturday morning for brunch. Probably waited around 10 min. I got an omelette which was incredible. The cheese was by far the best part. So much and flavorful. High quality ingredients. Potatoes were also very good. My girlfriend got the pancakes and really enjoyed them but said my order definitely won after she tasted a few bites. I'll go back to Pats next time I'm in San Fran
author: Brooks T.

description: Absolute gem in SF. Great food, great service! Only found this place after 4 yrs of visiting the city. All those breakfasts wasted in other cafes!!
author: Ciaran H.

description: While the food was exceptional the service was lackluster. While the restaurant is quite small our family of 4 was still able to be accommodated. We waited 20 mins and I had to flag down the waitress just to get a round of water for our table. The waitress thought we he already ordered since she couldn't see our menus. Find that hard to believe since my kids were waving them around like toys. Nonetheless just because you have kids isn't a valid reason to be ignored at a restaurant. On a positive note the banana granola pancakes are a must try, fluffy and mildly sweet without going into a sugar coma.
author: Anita L.

description: The food was great and there was such a variety.  My husband had the crepes and I had a steak and cheese.  The service and atmosphere were also good.
author: Patti H.

description: A great place for breakfast. French toast was amazing and they make a fabulous hollandaise sauce for the eggs Benedict. Mimosas and bloody Mary's were a perfect start to the day.
author: Dena M.

description: Good service, strong coffee, and a great omelette. I had the chicken Apple sausage with mushrooms, avocado,onions and cheese. Melissa had a waffle,bacon and an egg. We're going back again tomorrow.
author: Don M.

description:
Was looking for a place I could sit outside to cool off after a bike ride - sooooo many hills!  I was very pleased to get one of the two outside tables, I was dining solo, so being able to people watch was a bonus.   
Breakfast was very good:  challah french toast with fresh berries, and coffee.   Very good cup of coffee, attentive, friendly service.  The lunch menu looked great too.
author: Therese D.

description: What a treasure we found!  Pat's cafe is an eclectic, quaint cafe that serves up...well the most incredible breakfast on the coast!  The eggs Benedict were perfection, so make sure you save toast to get every last drop.  Pancakes were light and fluffy, as were the omelettes.  The gravy was just the right texture and seasoned well.  Joe had the Joe's special and was not disappointed!  Potatoes were seasoned beautifully.  Pat was having breakfast next to us so we got a chance to chat with her...she is just lovely!  Service was excellent but we joked they were on their best behavior being watched over by the boss...but I am sure you will get that welcoming warm fuzzy feeling all the time!  Bring your appetite and try a little of everything that will fit on your table :)
author: Chris F.

description: One of my favorite places to eat breakfast when visiting San Francisco. Food tastes great and the staff is nice. One thing I did notice that they changed was the way the cook their breakfast sausage. I don't remember it being cut in half. The flavor is just not the same for me. Their biscuits and gravy are killer though.
author: Rudy A.

description: The word "whelmed" fits here. Nothing that bad but certainly nothing that great either. It's a good family atmosphere where kids can get pancakes and parents can get an omelet. But being in SF they could use a big time upgrade in coffee and should offer something that would set them apart.
author: Gary H.

description:
I don't know where to start. Usually yelp is right on, but this place was a complete disappointment and waste of time. 
1. It wasn't very busy - but somehow after asking twice, water was too much of a hassle to bring over. My grapefruit juice was not fresh.
2. The food took a while to come.
3. I  had the breakfast burrito and asked for no sour cream, and avocados instead. In return I got two sliced avocados on the side slathered in sour cream.
4. The breakfast burrito was one of the worst I've ever had. The tortilla was cold, the cheese inside unmelted. It was like someone had scrambled one egg and threw it inside with lightly microwaved ingredients. In 5th grade my breakfast burrito making capabilities would have killed this one. 
5. The omelet with corn tortillas was mediocre at best. 
6. Maybe the "chef" forgot to show today?
author: Nate S.

description:
Great breakfast. Freshly prepared. Minimal wait.  My kids devoured their pancakes. Wait for food was a little long. Overall I was extremely pleased and would go back again for a great breakfast!

We went back a second time because the kids wanted the pancakes again. I switched from an omelette to crepes and they were really great! Service was much better the second time around. Recommended to a friend visiting the area right after we left.
author: Lisa D.

description: What a nice little spot for brekkie! Good eggs over medium, good breakfast burrito, and the lime/cilantro/garlic fries were great. Also very nice staff.
author: Alice S.

description: First rate breakfast. Always crowded, and deservedly so. Often you can get a seat at the small counter if you don't want to wait. Dinner just ok.
author: K. H.

description:
Got brunch here last Saturday, since we live in the neighborhood and have never been.  We were really disappointed.  My boyfriend got the french toast special, which was served on one really thick (like 3 inches) piece of challah (or maybe it was ciabatta) bread.  It had very little sauce on it, to the point where the middle part was completely unflavored and just raw bread.  Definitely the weakest french toast I've ever seen (including homemade versions).  I ordered the El Ranchero, which was exactly as described.  I don't know why I opted to pay $1.50 to add spinach, in retrospect seems like a ripoff.  The dish was good--just incredibly bland.  The beans were straight from the can, the spinach had no seasoning, etc.  I added lots of salt and pepper to give it something...  

We wanted to love Pat's but will never go back :(
author: Tami S.

description: Really nice little place down in the Wharf. We ordered 5 different meals and all were great. Quick and friendly service. Omelets were stuffed with the fillings and the French toast was made of super thick cuts of sourdough.
author: Jake G.

description: Average food, average service, average prices. Sadly that is a winner for breakfast in this area.
author: Unter C.

description: Food was solid. No complaints there. Service was slightly slow and it wasn't even that busy. I would definitely prefer to eat here if other places have their usual 1 hour wait times. I can not wait that long for the first meal of the day.
author: Nabeel S.

description: I love this place! Today was our first time going and the server was very friendly and the food was so good. Make sure to sign your name in right when you walk in the door. I would recommend this place to anyone!
author: Liz R.

description:
Best breakfast place i've found in North Beach so far.
Great service, decent prices and decent portions all with good quality.
Will be back for sure, thanks.
author: Brian C.

description:
This place is a neighborhood blessing! 

While we were dining we even got to meet "Pat" and she took time to sit and chat with us for a while about how we were doing and if we were enjoying ourselves. How wonderful!

The food is prepared to perfection, so don't mind the wait. The wait, however, is the only reason I dinged a star. Service seems to cater to regulars more than those trying something new along with no real place to sit and wait. 

We were however offered coffee and once our food came, a delicious breakfast experience. The portions are perfect. Everything is fresh. And the atmosphere is buzzing with weekend excitement. I'll be back, for sure!
author: Jeremy R.

description: I was visiting the city for a couple of days and read about Pat's Cafe and decided to try it out. Food was great but the service was slow. We were seated quickly but after 15 minutes had to "flag down " our server to take our order. Waited another 20 -25 minutes for our food to arrive.  While eating my breakfast I noticed that other customers who just arrived were taken care of right away. I usually leave a 18-20% tip but today it was less than  15% due to the slow almost forgetful service.
author: Lola V.

description: On our way to Fisherman's Warf we stumbled across Pat's Cafe. We spontaneously decided to go in for breakfast, and are happy we did! The food is excellent. Derive is friendly. And prices are fine! Aside from the fixed menu the weekend menu has a lot to offer. Highly recommended!
author: Grant M.
