description: Good food! I had a basic egg breakfast and my mom had the Mediterranean crepe (yummy!). The bright colors and vibe of the cafe give a nice warmth and cozy feeling in foggy and dreary San Francisco days
author: Ana Cristina J.

description:
Unimpressed with this place which was such a huge disappointment. I live a block from Pat's Cafe and every morning I walk by and admire how adorable and quaint the restaurant looks from inside and out.  In addition, I have observed that there always seems to be a crowd- so I kept in mind to give this place a try for breakfast.

Well that day was today, we walked in and it was pretty packed, luckily a nice patron informed us of the protocol and told us to go and write our name down on the list . We did and only waited 5 mins, nice turn around time- give them a star for that one. 

As soon as we were seated, we were greeted with water by the busser. The coffee was meh, I realize most small diners and mom and pop cafes usually serve watery coffee but needless to say it did the job. Service was subpar as well, I get the feeling they bank off of tourist most of the time. Our waiter wasn't all that warm or friendly and kind of rushed us, which was another reason I deducted a star. 

I ordered Pats waffle special. I was pretty blown about the portions they serve, they're really small. I saw my plate and my first thought was, "well, this clearly isn't going to fill me up"  The waffle was good though and the bacon was well bacon, it's gotta be hard to mess that one up. We asked for toast, which took forever to get and when we finally did get it we got four pieces of non-toasted bread and they charged us $2 for that crap. Which is another reason why I deducted a star, the food was just meh. 

Just a real let down.

I am back to re-edit after receiving a "compliment" under false pretenses from what it seems like someone who works there, they informed me that I was "so wrong" about my experience. Thank you for taking the time to inform a customer that their experience is "wrong". In my humble opinion, every one is different and everyone's experience is unique. We all have different standards- some people don't mind mediocre food/service when spending money-- and I'm here to inform you that I am not one of them. If you do work at Pats or just a fan, you really have no right to tell people what is right and wrong.
author: Dani A.

description:
3.5 stars. Cute neighborhood spot for breakfast, brunch, lunch and (now apparently) dinner. I came here for lunch and ordered the Cubano sandwich. I don't recall the price, but I know it was less than $10. It wasn't the best I've had, the bottom portion of the bun got soggy, but it came with a side salad which was not wilted!

I heard they had tiramisu - my favorite dessert - so I tried it. I thought, "Well, it seems close enough to North Beach so it should be okay." Well, folks, I was wrong. took one bite and knew there was something amiss. Fridge flavor. There was a slight hint of onions. LOVED the presentation, however. In fact the carmelized banana was better than the tiramisu. 

My rationale is: If it is going to go in your mouth, it may as well be worth all the calories. So I told our cheerful server Ashley about the fridge flavor problem and she promptly took it off my bill. 

Pat's Cafe is a colorful little spot with lots of local photos on the wall from local photographers. It didn't seem to be packed with tourists either, which to me, is a good sign. You have to draw the customers in with your food! I would probably come back here again.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
My friend took me here bc it's his favorite breakfast spot.

I ordered the California Omelet which was fantastic.  Huge portion and they weren't cheap about the stuffing - loads of Avocado, Cheddar Cheese, Mushrooms, Onions and Chicken Apple Sausage + Toast on the side.

But then I had a bite of Mike's regular, the El Ranchero (Toasted Corn Tortilla, Black Beans, Eggs, Cheddar Cheese), and my California Omelet just tasted like CRAP after that.  That thing was amazing!  The meat was perfectly seasoned with a little spicy kick.  It was like eating a dinner-size burrito for breakfast without feeling like a fat ass because technically, it's on the "breakfast omelet" menu!

Cute restaurant.  Great service.  Nice neighborhood.
author: Anh D.

description:
I'll teeter totter on this review and may come back to give it a four. However, right now it stands at a solid three. For me it was just your standard breakfast diner, with good service and great coffee. I would say the fresh sourdough made it  special but a lot of places in San Fran offer up that type of thing. 

Everything on menu looked good and I know for the fact that the steak and eggs were good and the omelet was cooked to perfection. So if there's a long line at Mama's head over here you'll still have a great breakfast to get your day going.
author: Roberto F.

description: Waited 40 mins for a burrito and a waffle, the silverware had the last persons dinner (and saliva) on it. There was something in my water, the waiters are rude and there was even crumbs in my to go box. Why do they get business? Because the line for Mama's was too long.
author: marilyn c.

description:
The food was really good and try to get the pillow booth in the back.

Big plus for the latte and potatoes.  Both were the best that I had on the trip in SF.

The biggest downside is the service was really slow.
author: mike k.

description: Delicious food. Corned beef hash was awesome. Accommodating to groups large and small. Very friendly, would highly recommend.
author: Kyle S.

description:
We were promptly seated by a courteous hostess; however, the wait staff was slower than expected, but the place was full of people. 

My companion and I both ordered Crab Cakes Benedict, which happened to be a special of the day. Although there was plenty of crab in the dish, the Crab Cakes Benedict was very bland. The biggest disappointment was the hollandaise sauce, which was supposed to be a house specialty, being tasteless.  The potatoes that came with the breakfast were good but warm at best.
author: Joseph W.

description:
This is a great neighborhood find!  We stayed at the Columbus Motor Inn and this was right around the corner.  Sitting at the front tables is fun to watch as the cable car stops and pulls around the corner.
The food is excellent.  We only had breakfast there.  Eggs and sausage were fantastic.  The best sausages I have had at a restaurant.  The french toast was a little tough on the crust, but the real maple syrup was great.  The belgian waffle also was very good.  
Wish we had more mornings to enjoy there.  The service was also excellent. Friendly atmosphere.  Booth in back is lined with pillows and soft things to lean against.  Nice for family or single person to dine at.
author: Cheryl S.

description: We had originally ventured over to Mama's but the wait was in excess of one hour.  Pat's is by no means a runner up and not having to wait for breakfast puts them at the top of my list.  Pat has a nice operation and great tasting food everytime we have been there,  Highly recommended.
author: Kevin C.

description:
Great food, horribly slow service. 
We live near by and have been able to enjoy their breakfast a few times, but even when their not busy the wait staff is notoriously slow. If you try to go in after 9:30 expect at least a 30 minute wait for a table and another 30-45 before you get any food. 
If you do have a chance to get there early, the sausage gravy and California omelette are great choices.
author: Katrina G.

description:
This place is a black away from my work and i go here all the time for salads, and french fries ( they have the best fries in the world). The cooks, host, and everyone else who works there are just soo polite and nice. They always give you suggestions on what to order if you are unsure. It takes a bit long to get your meal, but that's because they make it all from scratch so it takes longer but trust me its WORTH IT!!! 

The food itself is a mouth full of flavor that will explode on your tongue. You will be in paradise. I am a vegetarian and my new favorite it the Tuna Melt, the best tuna melt I have ever had. I've had other stuff all their salads are amazing, their hamburgers are just to die for or so my friends say that have tried them. This place also has a great breakfast menu which will rock your morning.
author: Svetlana T.

description: We were looking for a breakfast spot this morning and decided to try this place out since it is close to where we live. I got mimosa and an omelette and was not impressed with either. The omelette was bad and probably was the worst omelette I ever had. The home fries was not very good and it is supposed to be a specialty. I don't think we will be coming back.
author: Ina B.

description: Glad we chose this little spot. Plenty of seating and great, bright atmosphere.  Busy for breakfast (always a good sign) but not so busy that we had to wait for a table. The food was delicious and had something for everyone. No complaints here.
author: Lynn B.

description: I loved the food here. I tried the Mediterranean Crepes.....yummy! My husband got the California Crepes and he loved his too. The staff is fast and friendly.
author: Sherri E.

description: We stopped in for a quick brunch but were sadly disappointed. The hash lacked flavor, the eggs were poorly cooked and the biscuits were subpar. As fans of a hearty, country style breakfast we expected more from this neighborhood joint.
author: Kathy And Matt B.

description: Absolutely great experience! Friendly staff and wonderful food. Been driving up the CA all week and finally had a GREAT latte!!!
author: Matt C.

description: The food was great but they played The Beatles the entire time we were here. I mean a variety would be okay, but it was literally just Beatles. Would have been better with just about anything else. My boyfriend wanted to shoot himself in the face. We enjoyed our food though.
author: Rayna K.

description: We went to Pats for breakfast and it was delicious! My children want to comeback every time we're back in the city.
author: Nella L.

description: The atmosphere was great at this cute cafe. The food was pretty good. Overall I would recommend this place.
author: Darcy B.

description: Walked out after waiting for five minutes without a good morning, grunt, wave, go to hell or anything from the staff of four. I don't mind waiting for a table, let's at least pretend we care about the customers. If it was a lone person i'd have some sympathy, but not one of the four could be bothered. Wound up at the Starbucks down the block. What a disappointment.
author: Andy N.

description:
Breakfast is great, i've been here several times. However, service is quite irregular and often slow. Don't come here if you arr in a hurry, but if you have time for a slow breakfast it's a great place to be.

My recommendations: 1) granola with fruit and yogurt; 2) pancakes; 3) belgian waffle with nutella.
author: Albert F.

description:
We were visiting from out of town and found out about Pat's Cafe on Yelp. There really was a great atmosphere in large fact due to Pat's presence and her great staff. We felt very welcome which is a nice start.
The breakfast itself was a great success but I would be remiss if I didn't mention the great drip coffee. I'm picky about coffee this was no ordinary coffee which we all enjoyed greatly. To put more emphasis on our recommendation, we went back the next morning as we wanted to enjoy it all over once more before leaving town. Thank you Pat and staff!!!
author: Kobe B.

description: Dined here twice while staying in SF for a week. It's the coziest of little local places! The owner, Pat, can be found there daily and she's an absolute pleasure to speak with. The food is delicious---Satisfying in terms of portion size, perfectly reasonable amount of food for the price, and filled with delightful flavor in every bite. The service is friendly, attentive, and inviting. Not sure how or why someone would be dissatisfied eating here; Can't imagine not finding something of interest on the menu. Highly recommend dining here!!! Two thumbs up and five forks/stars of satisfaction!!!
author: Loretta E.

description: We found this place after deciding not to wait in the hour and a half plus line for the apparent tourist trap of Mama's. I am happy we came here because the food was excellent, servers were attentive, and the price was reasonable. I'm assuming The owner, Pat, was on-site as there was a friendly lady who resembled the picture of the storefront image. The regulars had friendly conversations with her and she seemed to genuinely care about those folks. I am not sure what more Mama's could've provided because this place exceeded the expectations my girlfriend and I had. We were seated right away in a restaurant where virtually every table was occupied. Go to Pat's, you'll be glad you did.
author: Sonny H.

description:
After seeing the great reviews for Pat's Cafe, I was excited to try it out.  Now that I've tried it for myself, I know I'll never return.

We visited on a weekend morning with a party of 4, so we expected to have to wait for a table.  What we didn't expect was for the party of 4 who was seated after us to receive their order and finish eating before our food showed up.

Long story short, we waited over 30 minutes to be seated, had to eventually get up and find our own menus and then waited for 15 more minutes for an employee to figure out that no one had been sent to even take our drink order.  Once our full breakfast order was finally placed, we were "warned" that it would be at least a 30 minute wait to receive our food.  I don't mind a little wait (especially in the city), but the place wasn't even full.

We tried to keep a positive outlook and hoped the food would be tasty and worth the wait.  No such luck.  When breakfast arrived at our table, it was average at best and stone cold.

To top it all off, prices were pretty high--even for a city cafe.  Don't waste your time or money here...there are plenty of other well-deserving business owners in the city.
author: Helene O.

description:
So, we were both off of work yesterday and wanted to try a new place for breakfast and decided that Pat's was that place. It was a little bit of a walk but it was worth it. The food was fresh and yummy. I order the breakfast burrito with chorizo and it was most definitely yummy! The little salsa that came on the side was super fresh and the burrito was chock full of chorizo.

We came into the restaurant a bit later than the normal breakfast crowd so the place was not that full and we had our choice of seating. Let me tell you the best part of our visit... The Waiter! He was attentive and very nice. He seemed honestly and genuinely interested in how our day was going. He was friendly without hovering. That is the reason this place is getting a 5 star from me. I will go back because the service was amazing! The food was 4 stars, but the service made it 5!
author: Brent C.

description: My daughter, son-in-law and I always looked forward to coming here since my daughter and I discovered this place a few years ago...however...we went here over the Super Bowl weekend.  When we walked in we saw that they were busy, no problem.  We were able to get a table fairly quickly.  Once we were seated and given menus it took a good 15-20 minutes for anyone to ask us if we wanted drinks or even take our order...while everyone else that came in after us was getting attended to.  Apparently we were seated at the owner's (Pat herself) station.  Once we got her attention, she was very curt and short with us.  She finally took our order.  Once our food came we realized that the Ham & Egg croissant sandwich that my daughter ordered was missing "the ham"...since we were so rudely treated by the owner herself we decided..why bother?  We finished eating and the whole time after we received our food, not once did she come back to check on us.  I had to go to the counter to pay our bill...which is when I saw Pat sitting down and having a meal with no care in the world about the patrons she left to fend for themselves.  I was always happy to recommend this place to family and friends when they come to visit the San Francisco area...but NO MORE!  Will not be coming back...there are plenty of other places who will treat their customers much better than the treatment I got!
author: Carmela D.

description: Best breakfast ever... Bacon best I've ever have... Scrambled eggs cooked just like my grandma.... When grandma was around and lived in San Francisco  she didn't go out to eat because she cooked breakfast better than most breakfast joints... Hat's off to Pat... Thank you breakfast.. Well Done!
author: Teza L.

description: Excellent breakfast... A bit highly priced,  but San Francisco is a big City.  Recommended.
author: Steve S.

description: Cute, friendly cafe. They are so accommodating, great food, strong wifi...only good things to say about this place. Great neighborhood spot!
author: Brittney D.

description: The food here is delicious however the wait is too long. We waited over 40 minutes only to have the order incorrect. Waitstaff was rude as well.
author: Amy T.

description:
Nice little breakfast spot really close to our hotel.
Ending up eating here twice during our visit since there was an open table out front both times and no wait.

Service was good both times.
Breakfast prices seemed good.. especially for SF.

Recommend the Banana Granola Pancakes... very good!
Also tried the Pecan Pumpkin Pancakes (it was Halloween after all)... those were a disappointment. Pretty flavorless and bland.
Weird how one is so good and the other is so below average.
The real maple syrup is a bonus, but having to pay an additional $1.50 for it is ridiculous.

Also tried the Joe's Special which was pretty bland too. Had no flavor.
And the garlic toast that came with it was two little tiny pieces of bread with tons of garlic on it. Not good at all.

So stick to the Banana Granola Pancakes............ those are great!!
author: Tim W.

description: Terrific, funky cafe with good food. Sit and watch the cable cars pass by. My chilaquiles were delicious. I love the local artists' work displayed (and offered for sale), on the walls. Good coffee and mimosas too.
author: Diane E.

description: I was referred to this place by a local who saw me fiddle with my smartphone as I had stopped on my bike.  I came by myself, parked my bike to a sign and walked in.  There were about three couples ahead of me, the place was full (they have a file cabinet in the mens room it's so crowded), but I was seated shortly.  It took a good while for anyone to take my order; let alone give me water.  It seemed folks in large groups were seated and given priority.  I was about to walk out when someone finally took my order.  I had the California crepe with avocado, chicken sausage, and sautéed mushrooms along with a poinsettia.  it was good, but the lack service and wait ruined my rating.
author: Jonathan P.

description:
Apparently Pat's has started having dinner hours.

I went for dinner with a group of about 10 people.  We arrived un-announced and the waiter accommodated us pretty quickly.  The food was okay, I ordered linguine with spicy meatballs.  It wasn't spicy at all.  I added a bunch of black pepper.  The sauce was good and so was the linguine.  There was a bed of vegetables at the bottom.

Other people ordered the steamed vegetables with polenta.  That portion was very small, consisting of a few pieces of vegetables and a 2" x 2" x 1" cube of polenta with some cheese on top.  Other plates with sauteed chicken were good though.
author: Wally W.

description: Banana granola pancakes sere so good. Pat took our order and the wait was not that long. I would recommend this place!
author: Emily S.

description: First time customer will never return. I walked in and sat at the bar to have breakfast. The server/bartender who was standing around, not busy, couldn't even say good morning or hello. He just have gave me a menu and walked away. Didn't ask if I wanted to start with coffee or anything. Place looked cute enough. Customer service and just friendly service is a must when it comes to whom I give my business to.
author: Allison H.

description:
Food: Everything our table had was great. Steak and eggs was cooked perfectly as I ordered. The chorizo breakfast burritos were good and my wife's omelette was tasty also.

Ambiance: Small narrow restaurant with tight seating and cool local art decorating the walls.

Service: Friendly and quick.

Price: Probably the best part, just about $10 for a very good breakfast.

Overall: Maybe it's me, but I can't comprehend how people wait 3-4 hours in line to eat at Mama's in Washington Square when they could walk a few blocks north to grab breakfast at Pat's Cafe instead.
author: Binh D.

description:
I can't speak for their weekend brunch but their week day breakfast was awful.  Nothing I couldn't have made at home. 

Halfway in, IHOP was looking real good.  I'd argue for the service here, but honestly, IHOP has the same service.  Or, I would go somewhere a lot better and pay what, $2 more for my food?  

The person in charge, however, was this elderly lady who was dismissive and chatting super loudly with her friends.  We were the only table there.  It's totally fine to have your own business and mingle with your cronies, that's what owning your own place is all about, but she just gave off a really weird vibe, almost like we were intruding.

I will go to IHOP next time, thank you; I get the equivalent of a senior discount when I bring in my Safeway receipts. 

Don't judge me.
author: Erika C.

description:
I can only speak to brunch here, but what I can say is complimentary.

The eggs Benedict were excellent...the eggs were well cooked, hot and runny, and the hollandaise had a very good flavor.  The accompanying potatoes were good and well cooked.  I had the biscuits and gravy as a side; they were fine but not great.

My dining companion had banana granola pancakes and said they were "something special", which is saying something because she orders pancakes frequently.

The service was great, the staff friendly and the atmosphere very relaxed and comfortable.
author: Scot W.

description: super cute cafe.. good food and great vibe short walk from our hotel room.my friend and I stayed to chat over a mocha for 3 hours and we weren't asked to leave.. decent prices for the food..will come back again
author: Janice A.

description:
3.5 Stars

This place has a good selection of food and service was good. 
I enjoyed a Turkey Cran Gorgonzola sandwich with Salad and my bf got eggs benedict. Cute lil place, good food that will satisfy your hunger.
author: Lynn C.

description: Delicious food and delightful service! A great way to spend a Saturday morning in San Francisco
author: Fara H.

description: When we arrived the restaurant was not full and it still took 10 minutes to get someone to take our order (only after we asked) and to offer us a drink. The waitress had a terrible attitude and refused to have the kitchen prepare our order how we wanted. We walked out. Life is too short to support such poor service with our $$$. Very poor form Pat!
author: J F.

description:
This place made my visit to san fran all worth it.

I came here after a long, laboring weekend of work to have brunch/lunch. The quality and craftsmanship of their food is excellent and service was pretty good.

I tried their club sandwich with a side of fries along with a nice glass of pomegranate ice tea. Wish I could get a chance to come back sooner, but itll have to wait till the next time I go up north.

Also, their corn beef hash looked delicious.

One start short of perfection because they seemed to have been lacking of some items on the menu. Maybe a seasonal thing?
author: dan V.

description: Great food in a relaxed and welcoming environment. And the original art on the walls is a nice touch too!
author: Luke M.

description: Had many great breakfasts here in the last 3 weeks. Great service & friendly staff. Brightly decorated & reasonably priced. Coffee refills & generous servings. Immaculately clean. Recommend!
author: Madison S.

description:
3 star lunch spot. Had a patty melt with fries. Ordered it medium rare, it was very very medium. Hard to get that one right I know. Fries were good. Dining companion asks for salad as a side for cheeseburger. Dressings are discussed. Cheeseburger arrives with fries. Waitress says "oh, you wanted a salad, did I write that down?". Um yeah. The onions on my patty melt were bermuda and not cooked quite enough to eat so I took most of them off. 

It's clean, it's quiet, it's ok. Probably won't go again even tho it is close to work.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
I do not understand how on earth Pat's Cafe has a 4 star rating???

I created a Yelp account just to write a review about this place because I am normally not the one to complain about food or service as I have been in the hospitality business almost all my life and my partner is a chef. So, we are typically pretty understanding when "things go wrong"; however, like I said, I wanted to create a Yelp account just for the sole purpose of writing a review about Pat's Cafe.

We are locals to the area. In fact, we live right around the corner from Pat's. In the beginning, earlier this year, the food and service was great. There was a server there named Greg who was just fabulous and attentive, but he left after seeking greener pastures. He alone made us want to turn Pat's into our favorite breakfast spot. However, as time went on, every time we have come back, our experience has been despicable.

The last time we went (which will most definitely be our last attempt at continuing to hope that this place will somehow bring back its original charm and deliciousness), it was a pretty slow morning (only a couple tables sat in the whole place). It took a couple minutes for wait staff  to acknowledge us after we walked in; in fact, the owner was on her Ipad ignoring us. We sat ourselves. We ordered breakfast items, eggs,  bacon and home fries, like usual. I ordered coffee, that was served by the owner in a dirty mug. We waited 30 minutes for our food, which normally would not be a big deal..but there was only 4 tables sat  in the whole restaurant. No one even seemed to be concerned that the table behind us was given their food and well on to eating, event though they were sat well after us. So something was definitely wrong here since other tables were eating before us and we just sat there with a dirty coffee mug filled with old tasting coffee. Finally our food came out...freezing cold. The servers were all chatting behind the counter, ignoring everyone. We notified the owner that we were upset, but she just stood there like "Oh..um..ya..okay". She had nothing to say that made us want to stay and eat...fail!

That was just it...we had to walk out. We have given this breakfast place plenty of chances to be a great North Beach breakfast cafe that you do not have to wait two hours in line for, but it failed us once again. I am bummed, super bummed.

I highly advice the owner to reevaluate what is going on. Highly over-priced art on the walls (there is a strange dinosaur picture in the bathroom obviously depicting how the owner views SF customers), slow service, dirty dish ware, cold food that has sat in the serving window or something for too long. It seems like no one cares there. I just had to warn my fellow North Beach residents that this place has disappointed me numerous times and is really not worth it.
author: M R.

description: You can't go wrong here. You can order brunch at noon! I had the peanut butter chocolate chip pancakes. They were amazing!!
author: Brianne P.

description:
Underwhelmed, especially given the Yelp reviews. My wife and I stopped by here for a late breakfast.

Pros:
-Serves breakfast later than a lot of similar places.
-Food is reasonably good (a tiny bit on the bland side though).
-Nice atmosphere and nice staff.

Cons:
-Poor service (had to flag the waiter down several times just to refill my coffee).
-Small portions compared to pretty much every other breakfast place I've ever eaten.
-A bit overpriced, just because the portions are so small.
author: Nicholas K.

description: this place is amazing! I came here with my two girlfriends and we absolutely loved it. their egg burrito with sausage was perfect, the service is amazing, and it was nice to see a place where locals regularly enjoy.  the presentation of the food was beautiful. we will definitely be back here !
author: Suzy N.

description: Banana & chocolate chip with fresh fruit, corner beef hash, egg croissant sandwich. The BEST home fries (seasoned, cooked well, crispy-yum!). Coffee was better than expected-I'm a DARK roast gal. All plates in party of 4 CLEARED. Staff were friendly and funny and honest. We WILL be back tomorrow! Thinking of purchasing a Pat's mug for reminder of our lovely breakfast!
author: Pam P.

description: Great breakfast. Wait was less then expected on a Sat morning. Staff was very friendly and the food was very good. California Crepes and Banana granola pancakes. Great way to start the day.
author: Ben and Carla C.

description: Food is always mediocre, service always sucks. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.
author: lindsay k.

description: Good food, cozy place.  Nothing spectacular but we were able to get in where everywhere else around was busy.  I had the breakfast burrito, which was filling and fresh.  Creeps are good too!
author: Amy C.

description:
This story probably repeats itself every Saturday for breakfast.

Wake up at 7:45. Get dressed and run down the street to try and grab breakfast at Mama's only to see a line of 30 people standing outside: Its 8:15 am and the place just opened at 8:00 am.

What are they serving in there that it's so good that you'll wait 1 hour for. (See my Mama review). I later found out.

On option is to go back to bed and sleep. But I decide to venture to an alternative breakfast joint. Enter Pat's cafe. 

I tried not to trip on the 3 sketchy vagrants sitting in front of the apartment right next to Pat's. No line. Immediate seating. 50% full of patrons. 

My order: 

Pecan Pumpkin pancake.
California Crepe (nice change to use a Crepe instead of eggs, otherwise just like an omelette).

Food was good. Total ~$18 (before tip). Restaurant was clean. Free wifi. Nothing to die for. Good food.
author: Tom L.

description: Fantastic. Our group ordered the French Toast, Biscuit and Gravy and California Omelet. All was devoured. French Toast was heaven. Crispy on outside but soft and mouthwatering on the inside. Thank you so much Pat.
author: Dana A.

description: This place is totally just ok.  I don't think we'll be back because it just wasn't that special and there are too many other places to try.  The service was shabby and slow.   Btw, the Eggs Benedict is sold only on weekends. Again, not impressed.
author: Alexis B.

description:
I have eaten here once.  I had a portabella mushroom melt and a salad.  I was there at 2:20 pm on a Wednesday.

The food was great.  The prices were great. The location was great.  The service was great.  Pat was friendly.  I only ate there once, so I can't say whether it's always great, but I'll definitely be going back.
author: Dan C.

description: We ate there on 8/19 and It's clearly a local fav..... and I couldn't agree more.  Pat was a pleasure, and I have to hand it to the staff.  For as nuts and busy as it is, they have the game dialed in, where they will get to you, when they get to you.  However, when they get to you, they are as sweet as pie!  Their lattes are like crack in a cup and their food was good.  We had omelettes were they were reliable.  Be prepared to show, write your name on the list and wait patiently.
author: Stephen E.

description: Food was great! I had the California crepe and loved it and my boyfriend had Pat's hash. We came around 8:30 and were seated immediately but there was a wait shortly after that. Service was a little slow as they seemed understaffed but everyone was friendly and the food came out fairly quick. We plan to come back tomorrow!
author: Kendra S.

description:
How frustrating... this place was literally a stone's throw from our hotel (San Remo) but we only discovered it on our last morning.

Give the area, it's inexpensive, friendly, you get coffee top-ups (wakey wakey Francisco Café) and the food is pretty good. The only complaint is the over-seasoned home-fries, which honestly tasted more like Doritos than home fries, but given everything else, well worth a visit.
author: Mark H.

description: This place was recommended to us by our hotel staff. The menu looked good but after placing our order, we waited over 1/2 hour then watched as patrons seated after us got their food. Asked the waitress if our food would be out soon & was told it took 20 min but that it was probably ready. She came out with our plates a few minutes later & everything was cold! When we told the owner, she just took 1 of the plates back to the kitchen without saying anything to us!! Got not idea what she planned to do because we got up & left...we won't be back.
author: Karlene D.

description:
A great neighborhood place.  Friendly service, albeit not very attentive and hard to track down.  As with other places, there is a list where you put your name down - it's on the counter so track it down.  

We didn't have to wait too long before we got our seats along the bench in the back.  Our order was taken within 10 minutes.  The coffee took a lot longer - they just seem short staffed.  

What we had:

Coffee - $2 - not bad at all for house coffee.

San Francisco Omelet - $8.95 - Fresh Basil, Tomatoes, Feta Cheese - this is probably the smallest omelet we have seen.  It was just warm and not very flavorful.  Came with toast and breakfast potatoes.  The toasts are already buttered and the table has jar of berry preserves.

Salmon Scramble - $10.75 - Scrambled Eggs w/ smoked "wild" Salmon, Feta cheese & Fresh Basil.  Again, not much to show for it and it's warm.  The breakfast potatoes are oily and not crispy at all.  

I think their sweet items maybe better - at least the pancake and waffle looked promising.  

Given the location, we will give it another try.
author: Gloria H.

description: I saw all the great Yelp reviews and decided this is somewhere we should go for breakfast...wrong! This place was nothing. The menu was lacking, the food wasn't anything better than Denny's (in fact Denny's might be better), the service was bad and extremely slow...it was mediocre at best. I wish I would have taken pictures to show how bad it was. Do yourself a favor and try somewhere else.
author: Greg J.

description: We were regulars at this place until I brought my wife and her parents for breakfast one Saturday. The waitress was the rudest server I have ever had! She actually had a melt down after she messed up our order and never returned to our table. Pat was there and despite us being regulars, did nothing.... Never will return -- shame, the food was good and the other servers were nice. (still giving it two stars because that waitress will get fired one day)
author: Brandon G.

description: Kudos to small business! I walk in and see the owner, Pat, working behind the counter. LOVE IT! Pat went out of his way to fulfill my requests.  Great bagels and Pat makes a mean mocha!
author: Dario L.

description: Tucked away in a quiet neighborhood.  The staff is very friendly.  The multiple choices of eggs benedict are great.  Art on the walls and cleanliness are a testament to the pride of ownership.
author: Neil C.

description: The food itself was pretty good. We had omelette, burrito, and biscuit and gravy. They had good clean flavors. The service was very bad. Everything seemed to go in waves, all the food came out at once, everyone was seated at once, servers made all the drinks and checked on everyone at the same time. It took over a half hour to get our food and another twenty just to get our check. Everyone seemed busy but not with serving the customers. We got more help from the owner than the wait staff. Not the best experience but pretty good food.
author: Amanda C.

description: With a line out the door I knew we were in the right place. Great service and even better food. The California crepe is amazing. The rest of the family got pancakes and French toast. There was not a drop of food left on our plates. Highly recommend.
author: Eric M.

description: Small but good for brunch.
author: Rich V.

description: My sister (who is a restaurant owner herself) and I were only in SF for less than four days, but we ate at Pat's four times! It's located conveniently at the end of a cable car line, one block from our motel, yet has a "tucked away" and "undiscovered gem" feel to it. Colorful, inviting décor, a very friendly staff--including the owner, Pat--and nice art on the walls contributed to that "we've found a home" feeling. We managed to sample at least seven different menu items between the two of us and they were consistently yummy, served with a smile and a joke or two. Portions were plentiful. The oatmeal was amazing, filled with apples and cranberries and bananas. Coffee was just right. We got back to Santa Barbara last night and I miss Pat's Cafe already.
author: Julie S.

description: Consistently love this place around the corner from my house! Quick, great service, I haven't had a menu item I didnt love! The California Crepe is great and you have to try the chicken apple sausage!
author: Amber M.

description: Happened to notice this spot walking around looking for somewhere to eat as my original choice was closed and was intrigued since it's sort of a bad location and therefore I had not noticed it for years.  Looked nice so tried out.  Full during prime brunch hour, but none of that crazy line madness other spots have.  I went for lunch and got a great chicken club-like sandwich with a bit of spice, but not too much, and some nice cheese that looked like provolone.  Great bread, excellent quality all around.  Cajun Chicken was the name.  Great fries and generous amount.  Nice spot for a simple sitdown meal especially around this dead part of Columbus.  Friendly service, though not quick, if that happens to be important; wasn't for me on this occasion when they were at full capacity.  $11.70 incl tax/tip, no drink.
author: Marc S.

description:
Great breakfast and nice atmosphere. A block away from all the tourist spots around Fisherman's Wharf, this is a great find.
Coffee is strong but good - not bitter. The Eggs Benedict are very tasty, especially the potatoes. Pancakes were a hit with the kids.
Granted, it is not Mama's but at least you don't have to stand in line for hours.
author: Frank D.

description: Try their Crab Cake Benedict.  Wonderful and the hollandaise was buttery rather than lemony which was perfect for the crab cakes.  My partner had the corned hash and for once it looked good even to me.  He said it was yummy.   I hear their coffee isn't great so we stuck with a mimosa and grapefruit juice.  Mmm....  Off to wander SF now.
author: Molle P.

description: We enjoyed this place. Very eclectic in a great neighborhood. It's everything I want in a cafe. We enjoyed a very good omelet and the Chai Tea Lattes were superb. Only thing keeping it from 5 stars was we did set for about 10 minutes before we were acknowledged. But they were busy, so no biggie. I would highly recommend this spot. Especially for the artistic types.... Cool art on the walls!
author: Jamie T.

description: This is a great find - Why wait 45 minutes for a table at the nearby Hollywood Café (which is good), when you can have as good a breakfast, about 1/3 lower price and no wait just around the corner.  Banana granola pancakes are great.  My new favorite breakfast place in the neighborhood!
author: Jack G.

description:
I work in the area and was craving a BLT. As my office is really close to Fisherman's Wharf, most of our options are really expensive for even simple items like a BLT sandwich.
I was pleasantly surprise by Pat's. As soon as I walked in, I was greeted and asked if I was eating there or to go. I'm indecisive so I stalled with a long "ummmmmmmmmm...idk. I didn't bring anything to read but I don't want to go back to the office." The waiter said he would get me a paper and I should stay. 
Pat came out to take my order and the whole time people were coming in and chatting with her on a first name basis.
My order was simple but prepared so well! They made the bacon just the way I like it, really good homestyle food.
Great small place. I definitely want to try breakfast here. It seems like a really good cute couple-y spot to do that.
author: Yvonne Q.

description:
I love going to Pat's Cafe.  Great food and great service.  It's always a hoot to see Pat, too. I love her! She's awesome. You can't miss her, she's always in her little red vest.  
Today I had the grilled portabello mushroom pita sandwich. Yummy!  Her salads are always so fresh, too.  She gave us egg nogs and it was nice treat.  Santa was actually eating lunch there, too!
author: Lita T.

description: I really loved this place! Great coffee...had the best crepe EVER (California Crepe - avocado, mushrooms, cheddar cheese, onions, chicken apple sausage)! My daughter had a pancake...so delish!! I LOVED LOVED LOVED this place. Wish I lived near it...probably would be there way too much and stop making breakfasts for myself altogether. ;-)
author: Colleen C.

description:
Great for breakfast, lunch or dinner.  Pat prepares true American home cooking.  You are going to love this place! 

D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S-!!!
author: Daniel-Ray C.

description:
8-7-14

Service was awful and food just as plain as plain can be.  Nothing special about this place, tourist prices and all.  

Pass up Pat's.  Local or not, unless you enjoy plain, bland food and are easy to please (and VERY patient), you can do better elsewhere - - much better.

(The only reason I gave two stars is that it looks and feels like a nice enough local place inside and the food was not awful)
author: Bob C.

description:
Went on Monday morning for a late breakfast.  We were looking for places that let dogs on the patio or outdoor seating. I"m not too familiar with breakfast places in city so I went on Yelp to help me decide.

Super cute little cafe! I loved all the colors and the atmosphere was very hometown feeling for being so close to the Warf. It wasn't busy so we sat outside immediately.  I had the cornbeef has and it came with breakfast potatoes and my eggs were cooked perfectly. My boyfriend had the Joe's special and he loved it! 

Great atmosphere and great breakfast :)
author: K B.

description: Very creative menu selection but the service was non-existent. We had to ask for coffee. After our food came there was no "how is your meal." We had to ask for refills. We even had to ask for our check. There's too many choices to put up with that.
author: Sam S.

description: Our service was terrible and our food was nothing special.... Took forever and our orders were totally wrong. Won't be coming back
author: Madison F.

description: Excellent choice for wholesome and good tasting breakfast. Very friendly staff and reasonable prices for this area. Highly recommended.
author: Bob C.

description: Very slow, indifferent service.  We did not feel welcomed, starting with the host.  Not a smile on anyone's face.  Our waitress was inattentive, did not ask how the meal was, did not offer to refill coffee or water.  She appeared to go through the motions, in slow motion. The kitchen and dining staff appeared to be in the weeds, even when the restaurant was not full.  Worst meal we had the whole time in SF.  Worst value - 1 waffle (alone, nothing else) for over 10 dollars.  Worst service, yet 18% gratuity automatically tacked on.  Please do not be deceived by the line-up outside.  Go anywhere else but here.  Poor recommendation by our hotel.
author: Poor A.

description: This is how breakfast should be, better then homemade. If you like Eggs Benedict with ham or salmon topped with homemade sauce or homemade Corn Beef Hash you will love Pats.
author: Kirk D.

description: Well, if you're actually hungry, don't come here.  Waiting 45 minutes in two plates of breakfast.  And the place isn't even that big!!!
author: Alyse S.

description: 4/14/12.  Small place.  We walked in behind a group of 6 (good luck finding space for them) and we wrote our name on the waiting list.  No one greeted us, no one checked this list, and no one acknowledged us.  The owner, I assume to be Pat, was not friendly.  We decided to leave.
author: Jen L.

description: Awesome food!! Came in for dinner and the next morning for breakfast. Incredible burgers and the French toast and coffee were wonderful. Do come to this place and also enjoy the art on the walls.
author: Steve T.

description: Poor service; we had to find a waiter to take our order.  Then 40 minutes later we were asking where our breakfast was.  It came out a minute later lukewarm--probably sitting in the window for 10-15 minutes.   Maybe an off morning but not checking in on customers is not a good practice--won't come back.  Lukewarm eggs and home fries not appetizing.
author: Hilary R.

description: Fun little breakfast/lunch joint in North Beach. Pat, the owner, served us with great hospitality. We had a Half order of French toast w/ fruit + one egg and sausage along with Eggs Benedict on Foccacia (she was out of English muffins). Both were delicious and just the right amount of food. I would definitely eat here again.
author: John A.

description: Great breakfast place! Very cute inside and delicious food. I ordered the Nutella crepe and my boyfriend got the pancakes. Both were delicious!
author: Stacy S.

description:
I dropped in here after a yoga class DYING to eat something, so I'll have to  check back in again to see how a not starving me feels about the food.


Server was very friendly, gave suggestions, and attended to me quickly. My only gripe would be that I felt a bit rushed-- that plus my empty belly caused me to finish my lunch dish in about 4 minutes flat! 

I got some pita sandwich that had grilled onions, spinach, avocado, and monterey jack cheese. Very tasty, and it comes with a side salad for about 8 bucks. 

Free wifi, no outlets though. Probably better to pass on the internet excursions here.

All in all, a decent experience. I'd probably come back here for a brunch date.
author: Adora S.

description: I work as a concierge in the area. I searched far and wide for a decent breakfast spot in the Wharf. It's not easy. There are many arbitrary places. Finally I remembered Pat's and it's now my favorite spot to send my guests for breakfasts. I get a lot of great feedback whenever I send people over there. Atmosphere is something that cannot be simply manufactured -- Pat's has it. The food is great too! Everyone's happy!
author: Nate L.

description: Good food - good service. We shared the egg burrito and was plenty of food. We would come back here again :-)
author: Heather K.

description: Nice hidden place on Taylor street but with excellent breakfast and coffee !
author: Preet S.

description: Love this restaurant for weekend brunch! Always great service, and delicious food. The staff is super friendly, and always makes your feel at home. The coffee is also quite good. I typically order the Shrimp Scramble, but the Banana Granola Pancakes are also to die for. You seriously can't go wrong at Pat's. It's always a terrific experience.
author: Mia D.

description: I absolutely love this place. I was in town about a year ago for a couple concerts and our hotel was right up the street. We ate breakfast here everyday for about a week. The coffee is fantastic, all of the food was fantastic, and the servers are happy to serve you. Went again here last week and it was still amazing. Definitely a place you need to go to while you are in the city.
author: Taylor R.

description:
My wife and I have birthdays the 2nd and 7th of November, and for years we've spent the first (long) weeekend of November on Fisherman's Wharf. We found our way down to Pat's three or four years ago, and we have breakfast there every morning (best in the city!). On weekends, they make eggs Benedict and three wonderful variations - Blackstone is my favorite, with bacon and grilled tomato in lieu of Canadian bacon.

It's hard to top delicious fresh food, nice menu, very reasonable prices, tremendous waitstaff and a homelike setting. It's sometimes packed for breakfast, much more relaxed for dinner, and we're always on day trips so no lunch experience yet. Pat's one of those people you feel like you knew most of your life.
author: Tom G.

description:
OK guys, I still love Beach Street Grill a few blocks away, but Pat's is SO FRIGGING GOOD.  When I lived in Russian Hill (sniff), I would roll out of bed and walk down the hill to this off-the-beaten-track cafe.  It is right smack dab in the middle of touristy Columbus street, but just off enough that it is mostly locals.  

BEST COFFEE.  Just get the house coffee, it is amazing.  Their salmon and feta cheese omelette is amazing.  My friends have ordered the california omelette, the mexican omelette (with chorizo) and loved it.  The biscuits and gravy SIDE is awesome.  

There is one waitress that is not very good (sorry lady), but the rest of the wait staff is awesome.  Highly recommended.

AND DON'T FORGET: FULL BAR!!!!
author: Priya R.

description:
Food was great. Service was horrible. 

I came here with a friend on a Sunday morning because it was within walking distance of my house, and it seemed to have good reviews. On top of it, we were starving and didn't feel like scouring Columbus for the 4th time that weekend.

We were greeted immediately, and then the woman who greeted us (I'm assuming she was a manager or an owner) went right back to making coffee, and putting menus away. We waited forever to be seated while staring at tables with half eaten plates everywhere. A table was finally cleaned off for us, but I had to get up and ask for menus.  We finally ordered, and our food was fine. But as a former server, I am well aware that the people cooking the food and the people serving it are two different entities. Usually, the servers get a bad wrap for the the food that they didn't cook. This time, the cooks did their job. The staff needs to go through a hospitality training. Just saying...
author: Seanté B.

description: Not the best brunch, but not terrible either... Pros: cute interior, good quality ingredients, good prices. Cons: food was not very hot when it came to the table (the mushrooms in my crepe were not fully cooked), service was slow (one waitress, one waiter, and one busboy for 10+ occupied tables)
author: Rachel S.

description: ok! so we wait for an hr to get a table, place order for eggs florentine and wait for another hr n half only to get my eggs Florentine with salmon :( I'm a vegetarian and specified so a few times to the waitress. Well mistakes happen, the waiter was very patient and apologized for the mix up. But i had to wait another 20 mins before my order appeared. Honestly, i've had better eggs florentine. Not to brag but it wasnt worth the 2.5 hrs wait esp when you were starving. I'm sure others have better experience than I did. The service is good thought!
author: Shal S.

description:
If you are looking for good, old fashioned, diner style breakfast, then Pat's is the place to visit. The restaurant was very busy with a massive 20 person party, but our waitress seated us quickly. This 20 person party will become an issue later.

The Plain Ol' Eggs with Bacon was awesome. The eggs were perfectly cooked to order (over easy) and the bacon was nice and floppy, just how I like it. The dish came with a lot of toast, 4 slices. I also tried the Belgian waffle which was really, really good. I'd be tempted to order that next time.

The only negative comment I have relates to the 20 person party. This place is not big, it's quite small. The large party swamped the entire restaurant and the service took a nose dive when they started ordering. While it is understood that the waitresses and waiters would be a bit overwhelmed with that large of a party, the smaller tables in the restaurant were completely ignored from that point on. I had to go to the front to ask for my check and pay for it there. We never saw our waitress again after she started working the large party. To add to the mess, that party essentially acted like they owned the joint and was clobbering every inch of free space up and out of their chairs. They were a detriment to the overall experience.

Overall, the experience was good. Since I truly believe that the service would have remained high quality if the large party was not present, this place still gets 4 stars.
author: Ryan C.

description: Great hollandaise sauce. One of the best I've ever had. My wife had the hash. It too was good but not outstanding. Great place  to start the day!
author: Andrea E.

description: We love this place!  Friendly service, great food, and a convenient location!  We try to have breakfast here whenever we visit San Francisco!
author: Mamie M.

description:
Another meal that goes hand in hand with friendship - brunch! Coffee toasts with a beloved friend makes eating an even bigger celebration! On Saturday I went for  a casual breakfast after my yoga class with my weekly brunch partner. We walked to Pat's, as it's really close to North Point and both our places. We had been there quite a few times before, so I thought it was time to write about it.

I found out about Pat's on Yelp, as it's away from the Columbus restaurants strip, and hidden just near the cable car station in North Beach. Surprisingly, it's an absolute locals' spot - never saw tourists any time I have been there. It's a neighborhood colorful little shop, no frills. Pat herself usually welcomes us with a big smile, and the whole atmosphere is really friendly and simple. 

I have had different things here: omeletes, eggs benedict, pancakes........And I will echo what other reviewers have said: stick to the sweet stuff! The savory is 'ok', not bad, but nothing compared to the pancakes, the French toast or the crepes. They are REALLY awesome!  Me being a big pancake fan, this is one of my favorite places when it comes to pancakes! They have a fabulous spicy pumpkin pancake, a banana and granola pancake and a fresh blueberries one! They are ALL delish!!!

For the simplicity of the place and the food itself, it always seemed to me more expensive than it should be, especially if you make changes and substitutions, like I always do. 

I'm a fan of Pat's, especially her pancakes! And whenever I want to have that comfort bed of sweetness, with fresh coffee, nostalgic cable car views and 'mom's service', that's where I go! :-)
author: Simone W.

description: Stopped by Pat's for Breakfast on the recommendation of the bellman at my hotel. Ordered the Polk Street Omelet with fresh fruit and a side of chicken apple bacon. Everything was very fresh and delicious. Even the coffee was good (and I drink a lot of coffee). Pat, a sweet older lady, was busy helping serve the customers. Definitely recommend Pat's Cafe for a yummy breakfast spot!
author: Ben B.

description: Food was good and coffee was fresh. Menu is fun and offered a lot of different things. Really nice neighborhood breakfast spot. Overall I'd give it a 7-10. If the waitress had maybe come back more than once to ask if we needed anything I would have given it a 9-10. Unfortunately I had to get up to grab an additional cup of coffee.
author: Michael G.

description: Went there after failing to beat the line at nearby mama's (a two hour wait at 8:30 AM?! wtf?). This place does not deserve its 4 star rating, it's a 3 at best. Pancakes were like "meh", prices were too high when you include the extras (added fruit bowl, maple syrup, side of egg) and the cappuccino was terrible. It was decent since we were already stuck in the area and in desperate need of breakfast, but otherwise I wouldn't bother coming there especially.
author: Noa E.

description: God, I love this place! Always good, great pancakes, and a real cup of coffee. It is small so early is better. Great art on the walls and you can buy prints. If your riding the cable car it is pretty close. We rode down from Union square, walked over for breakfast, and around the wharf all before 10 am.
author: Brad H.

description: Pats is AWESOME! I love the California omelet, but as a scramble! The Joe's special is also really good-- with the garlic bread. The french toast was a little bizarre though,  too bready. I live right around the corner and we go all the time!
author: Megan F.

description:
You'll be surrounded by tourists, but it's a good place for standard non-risky breakfasts.

Cute place, too.
author: Alex M.

description: Hidden dinner gem!  Well known for breakfast an brunch, but now just relaunching for dinner (as the chef went out if his way to tell us).  Excellent food, very very reasonably priced selection of great wines, and attentive service.  It appears no one really thinks if this place as a dinner choice - we stumbled on it in a rainy evening.  Anyway, definitely worth a try!
author: SF Y.

description:
I love this place!  I newly discovered this cafe while roaming the streets of North Beach with my dog and thought it looked cute enough.  A couple weeks later, I decided to try the place and I was not disappointed.  I tend to like sweet breakfast meals so more of the french toast, pancake types.  I had their french toast and it was FANTASTIC!  I also had a bite of my boyfriends Nutella Crepe which was to die for.  So good in fact that I insisted we go back another day in the same week just so I could get the Crepe.  

The Staff is great and extremely friendly!  I would recommend this to any and everyone!  A great spot!  I didn't give it a 5 star because the omelets aren't the best I've ever had.  Stick to the sweet stuff.
author: Natalie L.

description:
I started coming to this cafe a few months ago for early breakfast with a group of friends as part of our continuing search for the best biscuits and gravy in San Francisco.
We loved it right from the start.  Our server, Ashley, is a bundle of joy even at 7:30 a.m. and tends to our every need with gusto.  One thing that stands out about Pat's is that the sausage gravy is excellent and the biscuits and gravy are served hot, not warm like some other places.  Others in our group have enjoyed the French toast and the eggs with bacon and hash browns.
Service is prompt and tables can be slid together to accommodate our group of 8-10.  At 7:30 a.m., street parking is easy to find and we can be in and out by 8:30 a.m.  I recommend it highly for breakfast.
author: Philip C.

description:
Walked to Pat's Cafe for breakfast this morning from my hotel, it's conveniently located between the Wharf and North Beach.  We arrived around 10am and waited only a minute or two before we were seated.  The service was great and so was the food!

I ordered the chorizo, egg burrito which came with a side of potatoes.  At first glance I thought "uh oh that might not be enough food to feed the belly" I was wrong!  The chorizo was spicy, the eggs were perfect and also in the mix were some black beans! 

My partner in crime ordered the eggs and bacon and a side of biscuits and gravy.  He was very happy with the meal (wished he had more bacon but he always wants more bacon).

I recommend this place highly, it's quaint, warm, serves great food with attentive service!  I'll be back tomorrow!!
author: Steve F.

description: Really nice staff, good food and great coffee. The perfect place to stop after walking around for a few hours.
author: Jeremy H.

description: Got breakfast there was great and the amosphere is great very san francisco like if that makes sense usually tables available which is nice and it is just a nice open place with great food for those nice relaxing mornings.
author: Frederick J.

description: Taking off a star because they forgot to put my order in meaning I had to sit and watch everyone else eat for about 20 minutes before I got my eggs. Pretty average breakfast food for SF, nothing spectacular.
author: Nathan J.

description: Horrible coffee. Mushy, half-cooked French toast. Eggs and toast were good. Two people for breakfast came to $31! Not horrible service, but definitely sub-par. Dropped off food and bill in a timely manner, but didn't check on us or ask if we wanted coffee refills. Thankfully we didn't, since it was so gross. I fee bad giving bad reviews, but I wish we had gone somewhere else..what a waste of a meal.
author: Anna J.

description: Very yummy brunch place! I had the salmon omlet with feta cheese....so good!! My dad had the eggs benedict and it was excellent! Their hollandaise sauce is incredible.  We got to meet Pat (the owner) and she was very nice. Can't wait to go back and try the eggs benedict for myself. :-)
author: Jill T.

description: Nice little hidden spot in North Beach. The food was quality and the portions were larger than the prices (a plus in San Francisco). They have a good size menu and you should be able to find what you need to scratch your brunch itch. I didn't feel especially blown away by the service or the speed, and wouldn't make a point to stop by, but given its location it's not a bad spot to pickup breakfast in North Beach
author: Taylor C.

description:
Chose this place because of its early opening time. We came right at opening, and I'm so glad we did! Service was EXCELLENT. (Maybe 'cause we were one of two parties there at the time). I asked the waiter for his recommendation, and he told me to get the eggs benedict. The hollaindaise sauce is the freakin' bomb! 

As for the restaurant itself, everything is clean and the art is nice. I'll definitely come again.
author: Marc N.

description: Nothing especially good about our breakfast here. Eggs somewhat rubbery, "pumpkin" pancakes had pumpkin pie spices but no actual pumpkin, home fries a little cold, servers nice but inattentive. Toast tasted good, but as we were leaving found a patch of mold on the back of a slice!
author: J H.

description: Pat's is the best breakfast in San Francisco!  I lived here for almost 2 years and nothing beats it.  Eggs benedict is terrific, as are the pancakes and everything on the menu.  5 Stars!  Service is great and Pat is always there with a smile and a red vest!
author: Jamie M.

description: I had the California omelet and my friend had the Joe special. Great food and fast service. This place can get packed but lucky we came in the prefect time. I would totally come back for a second round :)
author: Linda B.

description: When I stay in North Beach at the San Remo, Pat's Cafe is my first stop every morning.  It's a great place for breakfast, kind of a combination tourist place and funky neighborhood joint.  I like that combination, and on many occasions I have seen cafe staff and regular patrons helping visitors plan their days.  The breakfast menu has a lot of variety, everything from standard eggs 'n' toast to Nutella crepes.  The staff is tremendously friendly, especially Gary,whose artwork hangs above several tables up front.  The decor is bright and funky with lots of local artwork adorning the walls.  Yeah, there's a Starbucks down the block near the cable car turnaround.  But you can do that at home.  Get your morning coffee at Pat's.
author: William D.

description:
Not sure why this place has 4 stars on Yelp.

I always have to wait for a table (I guess I DO come for brunch on the weekends) and the food always disappoints.  I've had the eggs benedict, breakfast sandwich, and the breakfast burrito and they are all just OK.  The only thing that makes the experience better is their nice strong coffee. Oh and the servers are rushed and not very friendly.
author: Ayesha B.

description: Great find!  Short walk from our hotel on the Wharf.  Awesome breakfast, courteous waitstaff, strong coffee.  Loved it.
author: Chrissy S.

description:
Came here twice so far both times for lunch.  It's actually a 3.5 Star but I rounded it up because their service is pretty good - props to them.  Pat's Cafe is pretty much a hole-in-the-wall restaurant that sits in front of the passing cable cars.

I ordered the tuna melt (both times) for $9 and you can pick your choice of bread (white, wheat, sourdough or rye).  They use albacore tuna and walnuts for the filling with jack and cheddar cheese.  For a side I had garlic fries (hey, I gotta keep the Twilight Nerds away from me and henceforth shall be known as Twerds).  The fries were stiff and definitely not the way fries should taste.  And garlic?  What garlic?  Exactly.

In the end, just come here so you can be "in-the-know" about San Francisco mom and pop establishments.

=====

-1.5 Star for week old fries

*3.5 Stars out of 5*
author: Chris Y.

description: The food is nothing special and a bit over priced. There was only one waitress (maybe Pat?) and she was not very friendly. It took a long time to get her to take our order and then a long time to recieve our food. I ordered a chocolate milk and she had attempted to make it frilly by squirting the chocolate syrup all over the inside of the glass and pouring the milk in and left it up to me to stir in the chocolate. I prefer my chocolate milk to be mixed for me when I go to a restaurant and didn't find it pretty, or charming. I think it might just be a way for them to save time? The portions are ok. but the large milk and large chocolate milk that my husband and I ordered were a bit small in my opinion.  I would recommend this cafe over Denny's and Ihop, but would definately try other mom and pop places before going back here.
author: Julie L.

description:
Pretty decent. Had...hmm.. what did I have?! That's right it was a sandwich. Hmm.. can't even remember what kind. I just remember the fries on the side, which were ok. 

Service was GREAT, friendly, really neighborhood-y. Food was above average!

3.5 stars
author: Art A.

description:
It's been all of 1 week since I was here last but I had such a better experience!

First off, the staff was awesome. They took our orders quickly, brought me my foam-a-licious chai quickly, and had our food on the table faster than I would have thought possible.

I had the eggs benny and it was the best I've had in awhile!
author: Britney K.

description:
This is North Beach's best kept secret for breakfast-it is not pretenious or have lines for 2 hours. The best coffee around and great breakfast plates
in a quiet location. The price is fairly reasonable for San Fran. Our waiter was the best. We all had different dishes and like them all.
Find this place and remember it!!!
FOR GET MAMA's unless you want to spend a fortune and half your day in line just for some french toast and empty your wallet.
author: SJ O.

description:
Pat's Cafe was where I ate lunch my very first visit to San Francisco. That was a few years ago, and now that I live in the city I am thrilled to be in the same neighborhood! 

The owner, Pat (always wearing her red vest), usually recognizes me or my Dad when we come in to eat. She has always been really friendly. I've never had a problem with service either. What is really good about this cafe is consistency. I've gotten the tuna melt over and over again and its always what I want! (And the fries, if you aren't afraid of garlic, ask for garlic cilantro lime. yum). 

I took away one star only because in the past I would be in the city and they would be closed for dinner, but Pat let me know that they are now open for dinner!
author: Allison B.

description: Once we arrived for breakfast, we waited for about 30 minutes outside while a table became available.  We were excited by the good reviews on Yelp and the fact that it seemed like a lot of locals were filling the small restaurant's colorful seats, so we stayed even when one member of our party found a nearby cafe with no wait time.  Once inside, the service was pretty slow and dull.  Crabcake benedict is my long-time favored breakfast item and I make a point of trying it at every opportunity.  I was disappointed in Pat's version.  The hollandaise went sadly beyond piquant into just plain bitter.  The cakes' were watery, somewhat fishy, and I hate to say it but almost seemed like they'd been made with canned crab. :(  I was disappointed by overall experience.
author: Sarah L.

description: My friend and I were inspired to check out this place after reading all the yelp reviews and I was craving crepes. HUGE disappointment. I had read people raving about the service here so I was shocked that when we got sat, we were ignored for 45 minutes. People who came in after us got their food long before we even received water or menus. When flagging down waiters or staff members we were simply IGNORED or told to wait because they were busy..... Busy wiping down tables that had left instead of taking our order.  At this point we were enraged and getting ready to get up and leave, when the waiter delivered the check for the gentleman dining next to us who got sat at the same exact time as us. The gentleman next to us had to tell the waiter that they were about to lose us as customers!!!! (I'm sure he heard our disgruntled convo) How embarrassing  is that? Only then did the  waiter came over and said "how can I help you?" with out any sign of an apology. I was simply SHOCKED. At this point we were pretty hungry and we had wasted enough time there and didn't have time to go elsewhere..... We quickly ordered. Food came out about 15 minutes later..... Nothing to write home about. Very mediocre and definitely not worth the appalling and rude service.
author: doreen g.

description: Sunday brunch here is great!! Our server Gary was awesome and took good care of us. We had called ahead for a group of 5 but there was still a bit of a wait when we got there. It was chilly out but they offered us a table outside. We took it and ordered our drinks out there. When he came back to take our food order he noticed we were cold and offered a table that had opened up inside. We took it and it was very cozy. It's a smaller restaurant but has a great atmosphere! I had a Bloody Mary and ordered the crab cake benedict, which is on their brunch menu. The food and drink were both delicious. I tried all of the stuff my friends ordered too and I want to go back and order everything! I had such a great experience here from the food to the drink to the service. I highly recommend it!
author: Pam D.

description: Not wheel chair accessible! Not stroller friendly! I came in the morning after NYE with a baby on a stroller and they pushed me aside! Made me wait and I asked why I could sit on an empty table and they said because of the stroller!! HATE HATE THIS PLACE NOT BABY FRIENDLY!! Don't eat there! Rude ppl!
author: Private U.

description: Had some odd things on the menu.  We just got bacon and eggs with home fries.  The home fries were warm but still crunchy.  Great little neighborhood location, but I guess I should have had the pancakes!
author: David L.

description: The food is slightly above average but the service is incredibly slow. It took them over 20 minutes to bring my wife and me a coffee and latte. We had to order three times and get up to ask for the bill. I almost walked out several times.
author: Mark S.

description: 3.5 now because Pat contacted me and apologized for the slow service. I was touched :) I will be back soon!
author: Antoinette C.

description: i have been here multiple times as i venture into this beautiful city.. i found this little place in the summer of 2006 when i took the bus from LA to SF. I was walking arounf mid day and i came upon a statue with a chalk board and a traditonal chunky chef in character holding it and the mom and pop vibe drew me in. I had the blueberry pancakes and the Popeye omelet.. Every year since that day i make it a point to stop in here just to have those 2 dishes. Nothing has changed still same quality and great atmosphere, the one thing that changed is now the statue is of Pat herself not the cool chef dude.
author: Dominic M.

description: Awesome dinner!  Must try there Steak entree and there Chicken Marsala.  Probably the best I have had in a long time.  Thanks Pat.
author: David F.

description: Pad,s little cafe a wondering walk brought me pass. Decadent food, fair prices but it doesn't get 3 out of 3 the services was slow inefficient and had to reorder my drinks 3 times which never came, which I was still billed for.... I know Mondays are slow days for everyone but I think that's a little ridicules if I can be so bold to state. Even so  great food & lovely modern art  style.
author: Christina C.

description: Great place for breakfast or brunch!  I had the Salmon scramble.  It was excellent and came with toast and potatoes.  My companion had the French toast special.  He ate every bite. Toast was made with sourdough bread and came with link sausage and an egg. So sorry we missed this place last time we were here. Great music, too!
author: Jeanie T.

description: It's a cute friendly cafe with a good hearty breakfast. What more does one want.
author: Richard A.

description:
Loved it. Pat welcomed us when we arrived and the food was terrific. A pleasant oddity... for being near the cable car no tourists! 

Still don't understand why everyone stands in line for Momma's when this fabu joint is five min walk away. 

They do serve dinner a few nights a week. Haven't tried but will give it a shot. 

Did I say Pat was nice?
author: Nigel E. S.

description:
I first became aware of Pat's for her great breakfasts. I am something of a creature of routine but Pat takes the mundane and makes it special. 

One night girlfriend and I were walking back to the house when we noticed Pat was open for dinner! How could we resist? 

Resistance would have been futile. For a small place she has varied menu. It was obvious this was new and a few bugs needed to be worked out but all in all a great experience. 

The staff was attentive and helpful. They were friendly without being cloying. The food was well prepared and the flavors were unique (NB: JMEK - not "very" unique) even on something as ordinary as fish or beef. 

Parking is impossible but the Mason Street cable runs very close. This is the typical small bistro that makes San Francisco a great eating town.
author: Stitch H.

description:
My partner and I are visiting San Francisco and we're staying in North Beach. After deciding not to wait in the eternal line at Mama's, I did a quick yelp search and discovered Pat's Cafe. The french toast looked great in pictures so we decided to give it a try. I'm so glad we did. 

We both ordered the french toast special with real maple syrup, scrambled eggs, and substituted home fries for the meat. When it first arrived, we were both a little skeptical because it looked like something similar to a french bread french toast, which isn't always the best. We were so wrong. The french toast was delicious. Despite being a larger, crusty, fresh bakery bread (ciabatta, as we asked at the end of our meal) it was super moist without being mushy and had a delicious flavor. The fresh fruit I got with it was great as well, a bowl of very fresh cut up banana, blueberries and strawberries. While the scrambled eggs and hash browns were nothing special (potatoes especially.. they could definitely be crispier and more flavorful), I do love their idea of a "French Toast special" where you get half the normal amount of french toast with some eggs and potatoes (or meat if you're a meat eater). The biggest dilemma my partner and I have when we go to brunch is we want french toast and eggs and this was definitely the perfect sized combo. 

The service was pretty good, but it did feel like after we got our food our waiter disappeared for a while (though all the staff was very nice). I could have used more coffee and by the time the guy came around and offered it, our meal was almost over but I asked for some decaf instead. He said ok and by 10 minutes later when we were paying the check he had never come back. I didn't bother to ask again because we were done with our food. 

The pancakes looked good too as did the yogurt fruit bowl. It was a big bowl of fruit with a giant scoop of vanilla yogurt on top. Looked delicious. 

All in all, we would definitely go back for more french toast.
author: Meghan S.

description:
Tried this place on a wet Sunday morning. The first thing I noticed was that it wasn't jam packed like most breakfast places typically are on a Sunday morning. 

Only one person working the front but she was attentive and pleasant. 

I had Chorizo/cheese omelet. It was OK, the Chorizo had too many different spices in it for my taste. Still good though.  My friend had a hanger steak which he said was ok, not great.  

One thing we liked was that they serve booze. We were able to get our morning bloody Mary fix before game time. 

Would I go back - sure, its worth a repeat.
author: R P.

description: Great food!  Had the eggs benedict and it was amazing!  My friends had pancakes and loved them as well.  It was pretty packed and we had to wait a while for a table, but it was well worth the wait.
author: Nichole B.

description: Slow service, bad food, full of tourists.    I don't give out many one-star reviews, but this place really earned it.
author: Mike R.

description: A cute little place for breakfast.  The soju bloody Mary is surprisingly awesome.  Both the California omelet and the breakfast burrito were filling and tasty.
author: Josh F.

description: My family had a poor experience. It was a holiday weekend and we were looking foward to going out for breakfast. When we     Checked in they said the wait would be 15-20 min, the wait was more like 35 minutes. When we sat down no one seemed at all interested in taking our order.  I tried to get any servers attention. I finally got a server to bring me a glass of water but I had to get up and go to the serving station. The food arrived and the eggs ere overcooked but COLD. Really? When the bill came the charges were incorrect. One of the servers told me it was my fault because I looked at the wrong menu. I looked at the menu they gave me.The owner corrected the situation but I was already really upset.
author: Scott J.

description: Oh yeah, banger steak and eggs , cooked to perfection in a timely manner, great way to start the day in SF
author: Nate P.

description: Surprising find.  The service was fast, the food good, and the local art was enjoyable.
author: Sam B.

description: While visiting with a friend we were looking for a solid place to get a great breakfast...Pat's Cafe provided that and more. Great atmosphere, traditional excellent breakfast staples & a great staff. No wait at 9:30a on a Saturday. Check it out!
author: Jaclyn G.

description: Very quiet, neighborhood restaurant.  The breakfast was delicious and the staff was very nice.
author: Antonia D.

description: Best place for breakfast! Rest of area is tourist driven and packed. Pats has great food at great prices. Really nice staff and food comes quick.
author: Justin P.
